description:
Quaint little restaurant right before you get to the Golden Gate Bridge. Little confusing to get inside, the signs don't really point you in the right direction, and it's part of another building.  
We came here for brunch, first I'd say definitely make reservations, this place is quite busy. I don't know if the face it was buys affected it, but the service was eh at best, nothing stood out. 
The menu is really small for a brunch menu, as well as heir cocktail list, even though it looks like they have a large bar option. 
The food, while good, was small and expensive. I got the quesadilla and it was only two small pieces. They took two small tortillas and made a mushroom sandwich pretty much. My girlfriend had the taco plate. Same complaint, good, but small portions.
author: John M.

description:
I wanted to like this place.  We walk by every week and it is always busy.  Took a chance this week after a nice day out at Baker Beach. 

Service: Perfunctory at best.  Unsmiling wait staff, a waitress that disappeared for long stretches of time, and an air of general ambivalence to everything related to the guest experience.  Notables: hostess telling the couple she was seating to ignore the dirty floor because kids had just sat there and made a mess (she eventually swept up) and a "grunt" when thanking one of the servers for getting us chips. 

Food:. Other than the chips and guac, the food was bland and uninspired.  I was really expecting much, much more from a TdJ restaurant. 

Net: The food was not good enough to overcome the deficiencies in service (or vice versa)
author: Gautam S.

description:
As a Mexican restaurant, the menu was very limited and no visuals were provided to help a newcomer such as myself see what there is to offer. As a tourist, this should not be considered a "Mexican" restaurant since no spices or unique seasonings of the culture were sprinkled into the dishes. 

I ordered the burrito and it just tasted like an ordinary Americanized burrito. No side dishes were offered with it especially given the price and the size was unjustified. I really do hope they venture into better understanding what makes Mexican dishes great and integrate it into the menu so they can justify the title of Mexican restaurant.
author: JaVon H.

description: Arguello was delicious. We loved every second! Alyssa did such a great job serving us!! And we loved the atmosphere.
author: Boone W.

description:
Overall, this restaurant is overrated. The raw quality of food ingredients were fine but the output is mediocre. For what we ordered, nothing was outstanding in areas of taste or presentation. The mushroom quesadilla was basic and so were the chicken taquitos. The skirt steak was tender but taste was neither here nor there. The skirt steak came with a cheese enchilada but it wasn't anything special about it. iThe menu also listed CRISPY Brussels sprouts but it came out limp and wet. Ice tea tasted watered down. 

Service was average. Our particular server executed her duties but wasn't very engaging or provide any real insight to the dishes.  

I'd give 3 stars for service, atmosphere, and there is a full bar. However, most important to me is food which I'd give it 2 stars.
author: Helen L.

description:
I didn't have a clue that chef Traci Des Jardins was behind this spot when I happened to be next door at the Presidio Officers' Club to see the moving exhibit, "Exclusion: The Presidio's Role in World War II Japanese-American Incarceration". On a recent Friday morning, I had just seen my dad's name among the interned and was feeling somewhere between pensive and peckish when I noticed Arguello opened at 11AM. Oh good, I'll have a bit of lunch, I said to myself, so I waited on the bench and in front of their patio gate. They opened the gate on time, and I asked if they were ready to serve lunch. Indeed they were. They serve a pretty healthy menu for a Mexican restaurant, but keep in mind this is Des Jardins of Jardiniere. That means this is not your typical Mission taqueria.

They offered alluring plates such as the $12 Quinoa Salad with arugula and pepitas and the $10 Little Gems with avocado, cotija cheese and a serrano vinaigrette. However, what caught my eye was the $12 Pozole Verde, which turned out to be a steaming bowl of goodness on a brisk morning. It had chicken, hominy, cabbage, radish, and oregano in warm chicken stock and topped with a fried corn mini-tortilla drizzled with creme fraiche (photo: http://bit.ly/2oI7Npy). Nice and it satisfied my periodic menudo fix. With a minty $3 Lemonade (photo: http://bit.ly/2tkTyeY), it hit the spot. Not to worry if it sounds too healthy as they offer five different tacos in the $4.50-$5.50 range and three desserts. Nice to be there before the lunch rush if there is one. It's the Presidio after all.

FOOD - 4 stars...lighter Mexican fare and pretty tasty
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...part of the gorgeous Presidio Officers' Club so very much a Spanish colonial vibe
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive enough as they seemed to still be preparing the restaurant for business
TOTAL - 4 stars...Des Jardins leaves her unmistakable mark on the small but impactful menu
author: Ed U.

description:
It was a dark, stormy night. It was abominably cold and windy. My friend of ill-fortune stumbled back into Arguello in a fit of panic and told the staff the tale of how her phone had just ran out of battery. That was her first time in the Presidio. Beautiful as it was there, she was stranded in unknown territory. The helpful staff took her in with open arms, shielded her from the rain, and offered her the usage of their charger. Alas, my poor friend, being one of the few Pixel users left in the world, was not able to use any of their iPhone chargers. One of the staff members then proceeded to dial her a Lyft with her own phone. And my friend was able to return safely home. One cannot ask for a better and more helpful staff than that!

PS. Chicken Taquitos came out fast if you want a quick bite at the bar. And it had good crunchy texture.. Yum!
author: Yad L.

description:
I've been to this place several times and each time I've had a different experience. On this visit, I was glad that we were able to be seated rather promptly (although there was a 30 minute wait to sit outside on the patio). I must say, this is a gorgeous place to have brunch, especially on a beautiful day. It gets the right amount of sun and you can catch some great views of the Bay as well. 

The hostess was very nice and accommodating (which is always nice when you're eating with children), bringing us two high chairs and having overall great customer service. For the most part, we were able to order quickly however service seemed to be a little slow. I ordered the agua Fresca of the day (my partner ordered a beer). Both drinks were good and satisfying. The waiter (who also had great customer service) took our orders and our food arrived pretty fast. One thing I did not like about the service was that we ordered chips and guac (chips were made on-site and DELICIOUS!!! The guac was rather bland and needed major seasoning) but that didn't come until after our main courses had arrived. 

We ordered the house tacos and the Mexican omelette. The house tacos were delicious, but I wish they weren't so small for their price (it's about $12-$14? And you get the equivalent of two small street tacos, one with shrimp and one with fish). The Mexican omelette looked good, but lacked a lot of flavor. We also ordered the corn cake, which was delicious however the fresh vanilla bean cream was super bland.

This place has the potential to be really good, but I feel like they keep running through chefs because the quality of the food isn't consistent (and if they food isn't good, then why pay?) The last time I came I had a great food experience but this time it wasn't the same. I am thankful for great customer service (hence the 3 stars), which goes a long way in my book. 

I will say that this is a great place for brunch overall due to its location (bay views), and being very stroller friendly (both inside and out). Parking is also plentiful right out front (but don't forget to feed the meter, as they are active on the weekends as well.
author: Tracy T.

description:
3.5 Stars

Arguello serves good classic Latin American food but it is more the combination of food, ambiance, and experience that leads me to give them 3.5 stars rather than just a 3 star review.

I think Arguello is best for drinks and appetizers. 

Don't get me wrong the dinner plates are okay ( pretty pricey and somewhat meh) but I am more a mission district classic three plate combo. Arugello is a little too fussy with the mains and the execution was flawed. 

If the weather is beautiful sit outside order some Margs, Guac, and their wonderful Queso Fundido.

Arugello is even great just to stop by and have a drink at the bar!

Check them out!
author: David G.

description:
Great location , fun staff , tasty margaritas, good food . 
We had a nice time , the atmosphere was pleasant. We had a fun waitress that made us feel at home . A little pricey but is what you would except, you get what you pay for worth every penny. I recommend the restaurant for a fancy Mexican dinner.
author: El C.

description:
With so many great Mexican restaurants in San Francisco, there's an insanely high bar.  This place would hold its own in the middle of the country where there are just Mexican-ish chains.  However, it's definitely not a destination Mexican joint in San Francisco.  More like you happen to be nearby in the Presidio and want alcohol and want a little food with that alcohol.

Chips w/ Salsa, Guacamole and Refried Beans: If drinking is your game, this snack option will do the trick for the table.  Don't expect someone to hand mix your guacamole table side.  Nothing is particularly amazing, but it's better than store bought.  The chips seem homemade, though some were a bit over fried.

Chicken Taquitos: Better than the frozen aisle version.  Kinda of a small portion though, with just three.  Loved that the shell was crunchy all around and the shredded chicken inside was tender.  The dish is a bit skimpy on the salsa, but not a big issue if you have the chips & salsa on the table.

Carne Asada Tacos: A bit disappointing.  Despite the "asada" name, it didn't seem very grilled. Kinda like the limp beef option at Chipotle.
author: Adam B.

description: Went for dinner while visiting my Uncle Darrell at the Presidio Bowl. Holy gosh dang, the menu and prices throw you off guard at first, but you can taste the care, detail, and freshness in every bite. Thank you Chef. We'll be back next time we're in town.
author: Julian G.

description:
A Spanish cottage atop the Presidio. Dark wood furniture, leather weaved chairs, mahogany pillars, and sconce-lit background are what give this place personality. We arrived on taco Tuesday. Three tacos for ten dollars. I had the Maleficent beverage. It's similar to a sangria. 
The staff was nice. The bathrooms are a bit of a hike. Well kept though.
Next to the Officer's Club. Handsome lobby with a sexy fireplace.
I have no idea why this place has anything lower than 4 stars.
author: Faizah C.

description: I cannot praise this restaurant enough.  We arrived very early but they sat our group of eight at our reserved table anyhow - even though we all hadn't yet arrived.  They were all so patient, bringing us many drinks and chip refills before we could finally order our food.  And the tricky part ... I'm vegan.  Anastasia was immensely knowledgeable and nonjudgemental.  She is simply the best.  The food was outstanding and the atmosphere easy-going and cozy.  I want to go back for brunch and enjoy that gorgeous heated patio.
author: Deb Doran D.

description:
Don't understand the 2.5 avg review rating. What are people expecting really? This place screams dog lovers go wild. Yeah if you are on a hiking expedition and your fur daughter needs a place to hang out for an hour and you want to get your hands on a margarita. This is your spot. Brunch is simple. Not a lot of variety but it reminds me of Mexico's resort area, just good food but not a lot of crazy stuff. Suits me just fine. Excellent chips and guac. Abby gets to have her own bowl of water plus some chips that "accidentally" fell off the table. 

Brunch items are perfectly serviceable. It's not big. Portion was more like appetizers, which could be the reason why people complain. But, and this is strictly coming from a dog lover's point of view, I think San Francisco is not exactly the most dog friendly town, like Carmel is, so to find a place that takes dogs and actually love dogs, this place is far better than most. 

Abby enjoyed some chips, some taco, and some water plus her dog biscuits, but what she really loved was all those people coming up to her to pet her and tell her how pretty she is. 

An excellent venue to chill after a hike in the park with your fur baby.
author: Victoria E.

description: This place is in the presidio and has a paid parking lot which is super easy. They have a dog friendly patio which is a huge plus for us. I had the huarache and the maza crust was tasty. Unfortunately, the poached eggs on top were over -cooked and overall the dish did not have much flavor. Two members of my party enjoyed the torta. We also had chips and guacamole which was delicious. The service was not great - I asked for water 3x before i was served water. They have a variety of margaritas and you can save a couple $ by getting a pitcher if you have a group.
author: Christine A.

description:
Happened to experience Arguello, and to say the least, was not impressed at all. This restaurant may claim it serves "Mexican" food,  I would argue that is a stretch. "Inspired by Mexican cuisine" is closer to what's real. 

This place has a great ambiance, but the food (quality and quantity) leave a lot to be desired. I had the burrito, and ...It was just a plain burrito - nothing special about it. There's nothing inspiring or different about the food, it didn't even come with an accompanying side for the $11 price!

I wouldn't come back here if I had the opportunity.
author: Jerry W.

description:
Excelente! We came and sat on the patio with our perrito and true to presidio weather karl was keeping it chilly. Luckily for us Arguello has heat lamps and a cozy fire pit. We shared everything familia style, and ordered chips & guac, alpastor tacos (x2), totopos, and watermelon salad. For four people I'd definitely say that was enough. Favorite was definitely the al pastor tacos- I probably could have eaten like five more. Can't comment on the drinks because I'm off the sauce temporarily. 

Service was nice- laid back but not absent.
author: Alyssa J.

description: What a treat to eat in this lovely historic setting and building.  My family decided to try this restaurant for my daughters birthday celebration.  We were seated right away as we had made reservations-we were greeted graciously by our server.  Drinks ordered, apps and all were served together and efficiently.  We loved the guacamole.  Our meals were enjoyed by all.  The snapper was delicious.  The two taco dishes were good.  The ceviche and taquitos  tasty.  My youngest loved the little gem salad and her quesadillas .  The margaritas had unique flavors.  Definitely elevated Mexican fare.  Happy to have tried.
author: Nancy M.

description:
Had a really fun light dinner with one of my true BFF tonight at Arguello. Staff was friendly and responsive. They were taxed with keeping up with 3 or 4 separate dining areas areas, but kept a smile on! The place, food and views are a real SF treasure. 
I will be back!
author: Julie F.

description: This place is a real gem for brunch and just about any meal. It is in the old Presidio officers club (a truly amazing space!) and while it is a bit out of the way parking is easy, as is bus transport (with a short walk), and as of April 2018 it was not crazy busy for brunch with easy reservations available online and easy walk in. The food was what I would call "high" Mexican/California fare and the drinks were top notch with an emphasis on Tequila  and Mezcal drinks. Staff were talkative and friendly at the bar - something I think makes a big difference! By the time we got up here and had brunch we laughed that we'd still be in line elsewhere in town.
author: Marc R.

description:
Yum!!!!
This is a great restaurant in a gorgeous setting! I had no idea it was even there. 

A few friends and I decided to have brunch while our kids were at a birthday party at House of Air. Everything was delicious! We had cocktails (Pisco Sour, Arguello Margarita, and Secret Garden) - all great. Then the salsas and guac, taquitos, and poke. Then we shared the chilaques and taco plate. We all loved everything.

It's a hidden gem. And at $100 for all three of us,
Not too pricey either.
author: Karen N.

description:
After attending the one-hour tour of the Presidio Officer's Club, the docent recommended Arguello for lunch.  We were so hungry, so we took the advice. 

I wasn't in the mood for any alcohol, so I ordered a cup of coffee.  It was good and satisfying.  The guacamole was the best I ever had in my life!!  
I don't eat Cal-Mex food enough to really compare, but the chilaquiles I ordered was delicious!!!  It was a very big serving, so I took a half home and enjoyed it again for dinner.  

This will be my go-to place when I'm at the Presidio :-)
author: Takako S.

description: Lowered expectations after reading yelp reviews, but, located nicely in the presideo after a 6 mile walk .  Lunch has limited option with counter ordering and delivery to tables.  The beer and wine were good.  The chips and guacamole were super tasty. The tacos were good but could be a bit tastier (so I added some guacamole). Well priced and located.
author: Mary M.

description:
Be warned that the parking is VERY difficult on Sundays that have Picnic in the Presidio - we had a 1:30pm reservation circled for 30 minutes and only found a spot very far away. During this process, we called Arguello to ask if they had any reserved/dedicated parking for patrons and the person who answered said, "I don't know."
Plan accordingly!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Not sure why the review is low but we enjoyed it here. Derver was very nice and informative, even went out of her way for us.

Started out with chips and guac, yummy guac. Chips was freshly made in house.

I had that hancheros? That was delicious. The boyfriend had the tacos. He said it was good but a little too small and not enough food.

Coffee was organic and local, tasted delish. 

Great place. Will be back again tomorrow for lunch.
author: Gloria M.

description:
Beautiful interior, very nicely decorated. I especially like the historical artifacts on the wall and the old photos. If its warm enough outside, I think the patio would be quite enjoyable.
Regarding the dining experience, while the food tasted good, I would stick with just the starter menu as the Mexican poke was absolutely delicious. I was irritated that chips were not provided, chips are a staple at any Mexican restaurant, and to not provide them complementary was annoying. Rather you have the option to get chips, salsa and guac for $9, or just guac for $6?! Secondly we decided to get a pitcher of margaritas because the price on the menu the price was shown as $11 for margarita and $40 for a pitcher. Usually when you show two different prices in the same line, its because there is an incentive to the consumer to select the larger item because there is some type of cost savings. When the "pitcher" arrived, the container looked like a wine carafe, which is smaller than a pitcher, and we probably got at the most 3.5 drinks out of it total, which is no cost savings, and at that rate we should have just bought 4 drinks, because at $4 more, I would have preferred a whole second drink instead of splitting the remainder margarita between our two glasses. 
For entrees/larger plates - there is only one taco option and its pork. I'm was very surprised that there were no steak or chicken taco options, as I don't eat pork, and it seems to be a more common thing in the Bay Area. There were three seafood inspired dishes on the menu, crab enchiladas, snapper, and a shrimp dish, however I was surprised there weren't other classical items, such as street tacos, chile relleno, some type of mexican inspired burrito, or a steak dish.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Food good (4 Stars) / service weak (2 stars).  Ordered margaritas before we ordered the meal, never showed up.  Half the table got served, then 15 min later the other half.  Asked for water 4 times, finally came after everyone was done eating.

It's just not that hard, please hire someone that can train folks and get the kinks out.  If they could get it right, I would go a lot more.
author: Brian D.

description: Great service and awesome food! I've been for both brunch and dinner and really enjoyed the mezcal, margaritas, fish tacos, ceviche, and chicken taquitos! Beautiful and rustic atmosphere nestled in the Presidio.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
This is really 3.5 stars. If it was less expensive or the servings were bigger it would be four. 

The margaritas are great but there's a lot of ice so for the price they seem to go a bit too fast. The food is good but again, I wish there were more of it for the price point. 

Nice outdoor seating with a fire and close to the view of the water and the GG bridge. 

(The Presidio bowling alley is across the street, if you're so inclined...)
author: Tanya W.

description: Indoor/outdoor seating with a fire pit. Pets allowed outside. Server was nice but slow and menu pricey for portions. Guacamole and salsa was good and fresh. Chips are thick and a bit greasy. The ($11) quesadilla was just ok. Very small w/o much filling so you really just tasted the corn tortilla. (They charge for chips and salsa). Maybe a nice place after golf but wouldn't make a special trip there.
author: Dawn S.

description:
Gourmet Mexican cuisine at a reasonable cost. Friendly staff will welcome you and treat you well! 
The chef creates new and unique takes on traditional Mexican food with unexpected results. My wife and I visited the city and were told by a friend to check out this great almost hidden gem. 

Exceptional selection of agave drinks and great bar service. We really enjoyed the Argentinian malbec. 

Located at the top of the presidio in a repurposed military building, the management has done a great job creating a relaxing and beautiful high end Mexican atmosphere. 

Definitely worth the drive up the hill and you get a beautiful view of the bay and Bridge. 

Try the new York strip steak. It's amazing and probably the best dish I had in SF while on vacation.
author: Aloha T.

description:
Went for a Taco Tuesday during lunch hours about a month ago...

They were mediocre. One shrimp piece for my shrimp taco. Okay al pastor... ok fish taco. Each taco was about 1 or 2 bites. The tortilla... it's as if I microwaved day old tortilla; it was kinda dry and stale.

To top it all off, $3 was way too much to pay for each taco. But at least they were edible.
author: Lilian C.

description: We had brunch here on Saturday. It was quick and servers were very friendly. The burrito was fantastic. It was some of the best pork I have ever had! Great place to stop if touring around the Presidio!
author: Maryann E.

description:
I normally like to visit a place more than once before leaving a review but I had to ask for water three times. Being a party of 8, we require somewhat special attention but having to ask for something as basic as water several times was annoying.

Beyond that, service was decent for a slow Friday night. The food was okay. It's nothing to write home about and a tad overpriced for what you get. The churros with the cajeta sauce were pretty good, though. I probably won't be back unless someone I'm with really, really wants to eat there.
author: Robyn P.

description: Nice atmosphere fresh made chips and guac!  Good service.  Huevos Rancheros and Huevos Motuelenos were both saticfying and not overly large.
author: ChaCha A.

description:
This place needs more photos of their Pozole soup on their yelp page because it is delicious and comes in a larger portion than expected! This restaurant has a good variety of seating, glad they have outdoor seating as well because it was a beautiful day out the day my colleague and I decided to go. I'm frequently in the area and heard it's great for wedding receptions or small private dinners.
Good flavor, good size, and fast service so I will be back!! (Specifically for more Pozole or their banana pancakes on the weekends during brunch hours!)
author: Laura Y.

description:
We've lived in SF for four years and finally made our way out to Arguello. The star rating that arguello has nowhere near justifies the meal we just had. We learned that the previous reviews came under an old chef...this new chef and team know what they are doing. We know Arguello will be the next hot spot. 

If you go..order the wagyu steak, it melts in your mouth. Pair it with the Oaxaca bird and youre set to have a great time.
author: Priscila M.

description: Decided to try this place while visiting the Presidio. It was last Friday. From the moment we walked in it wasn't that great. First, the woman that greeted us, actually she very rudely cut us off and told us to wait when we tried to talk to her. Sorry if you're having a bad day but let's be professional shall we? Anyway she continued taking our order with some attitude. The food wasn't that great I've had better. Being that I do not like cilantro (yeah right I don't) everything was put on the side that was fine however the taquitos were very greasy. The quesadilla was unappetizing. The tacos were fine.
author: Annette W.

description:
Ambiance and service is good.(the hostess was especially nice and welcoming)
But the food is very underwhelming. Way overpriced, disappointed and unsatisfied after an $80 bill for 2 people. Ordered the snapper plate which was very basic with a side of tasteless rice and very bland assortment of chopped zucchini. And the tacos, which I couldn't even finish because the meat was so over salted. I hate to write a bad review, but It's just a shame because the location is awesome. But the price points are just not worth what you get
author: Drea L.

description:
probably the worst food I've ever had. 
I had the chorizo con papas and when it came it looked like dog food.. Very unappetizing presentation, the food tasted horrible, I really caution people to come to this restaurant. I don't think they know how bad their food tastes. the portion is also very small so my family and I weren't full at all. I am so disappointed and wasted 50 bucks on the crappiest meal ever in my life
author: Samantha C.

description: I came out here for lunch due to a friend's recommendation and Arguello did not disappoint. The server and bar tender were friendly and it was pretty relaxed ambiance. I ordered a seasonal shandy and it was a very citrusy and refreshing beverage. I'd definitely get it again. I also had a chicken chili verde and a crispy fish taco with cilantro rice. I enjoyed both tacos but if I had to choose the crispy fish was my favorite. I would recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a good Mexican place for lunch.
author: Christopher W.

description: Love this place! Chef Jose had really turn this place around! You can see his love and passion for food in every dish! Great drinks service was outstanding great Mexican restaurant in a great location.
author: Cisco D.

description:
This restaurant is good, not great. 

I came here for brunch with a large group of people. First off, it's more convenient than your average SF brunch stop, albeit a little out of the way in the Presidio, but you can make a reservation and there is plenty of parking in front of and nearby the restaurant. The space itself is beautiful. There is an outdoor seating area with tables and benches that is kept very clean as well as plenty of tables indoors. It's also located within a museum (?) so you kind of have to navigate to the bathrooms, but those are also kept very clean. 

I know people gripe about the service here, but I really had no issues. The wait staff was lovely - we were offered seating before the whole party arrived and they were quick to check up on us to offer drinks and some starters. 

The food itself here was the most underwhelming part. For the atmosphere of the restaurant, I found the food to be really meh. Firstly, they say you eat with your eyes. Dishes here are definitely not the most visually appealing. Beyond that, I would say my food was tasty, but nothing that would make me want to return here over any other Mexican restaurant in SF. We ordered:

- Huevos Rancheros: definitely underwhelming. It came with tortilla, cheese, and egg, surrounded by refrained beans and salsa. Visually, no other colors but brown and red. I would have liked maybe some chopped salsa (tomatoes, onions?) or guacamole/aioli of sorts? It was not inedible or anything, but again, one of the most disappointing Huevos rancheros I've ordered.

- The fish tacos were good - reasonably priced, battered and fried very well, and this came with a great sauce and slaw. If I had to come back, I would probably stick to the tacos.

To summarize: a great beautiful, open space, friendly staff, but just very mediocre food. For that reason, I'm not sure I would make the trek out to return here.
author: Sarah N.

description: This place is awesome!  Such a gem in the Presidio.  I was here with a client planning the details of her wedding (yes, they do weddings!!) and stuck around to miss the bridge traffic back to Walnut Creek.  Such a great decision... literally the best margarita I've had since moving to the Bay Area from San Diego.  Amazing chips and guac.  All around a great atmosphere, food, staff and drinks.  I will be back... and can't wait for the big wedding in 2 weeks!  Vendor meal is tacos... yippie for us!!!
author: Erin D.

description: Went for brunch on 12/09/17.  Banana pancakes are amazing!  Server was a bit robotic, but wasn't expecting much.  Parking is free and easy.  Definitely will be back.
author: Liane F.

description:
This place is great - no idea why their yelp rating is so mixed. Food is clean, delicious, non-tradish Mexican fare, spiced expertly and in perfect, moderate portions - meaning you usually leave feeling full instead of ready to explode. 

Great for parents. Dog friendly on the patio, though it does get chilly on foggy eves. 

Bar is excellent - the bartenders killl it with the Arguello margaritas and expansive  Mezcal selection. 

I had the chips / guac and cheese enchiladas. Excellent . 

Can't wait to return with my wife!
author: C O.

description: After a 6 mile walk we saddled up to the bar for much needed drinks and appetizers. Tried many of the seasonal cocktails but loved the pisco sour the best. Chips, salsa and guacamole were great too. Shout out to our awesome bartender Kudi!
author: Kathy S.

description: Love this spot. The margaritas and fish tacos are delicious. It's a particularly great place to come after a chilly day hiking in the Presidio! We happened there on a taco Tuesday for lunch over break, and they had a special with 3 mix and match tacos. It's in the Presidio Officers Club area so parking is fairly easy and there was a nice room next door with a beautiful fireplace if you end up walking around the Officers Club.
author: L C.

description: Slow service and not very friendly staff. Our waitress didn't write our order down and she got all of our orders wrong, we had to ask for our drinks 3 times before we received all of what we ordered. I cannot recommend this nor will I ever return. Bummer because I really did want it to be one of our weekend go to places.
author: Mike D.

description: Stopped in after Off The Grid for a cocktail and dessert. The hostess sat us in the Anthony Bourdain area...because she repeated twice how we had, "NO Reservations"! We also sat staring at each other because we also had NO Service. Some seats opened up at the bar and we moved. Andy the bartender saved the day!!! She was warm and welcoming. Recommended a margarita, the Flan and horchata ice cream. All delicious. We went from being ignored to having a great time. If you go... sit at the bar and ask for Andy...she is a gem!
author: PJ C.

description: This is one of my favorite cocktail places in the city. Ask for the seasonal tequila drinks menu--you'll be so thoroughly delighted! The food is just as heavenly as well. Chips and guacamole are made fresh in the house and infinitely flavorful. The portion on the brunch menu varies so order a few things to share and you'll get to taste all the different Mexican/California inspired, modern dishes this place has to offer. Even if you're not hungry, definitely come for the ambience!! You can see the ocean from the patio, watch the afternoon fog rolling into the Bay, rays of sun moving through the trees above, and the flickering flames from the fire pit radiating warmth in a crisp early evening. This place is such a gem in the Presidio!
author: Elsie S.

description: Funny place.  The marketing around it is kind of phony and pretentious.  If you call their number, it is impossible to talk with a human being and I don't understand the glorification of Traci Des Jardins.  Having said that,  the food is very good and the service is excellent.  The ambiance is lively and fun.  There is a tall, female bar tender who is great.  We had a variety of dishes, most of which were great and some just OK.  I rarely eat steak but decided to try it.  It was not what I expected but the mushrooms and sauce on it were excellent.  I recommend Arguello as an occasional choice.
author: Ralph B.

description:
Sitting at the Presidio Officer's Club on Cinco de Mayo I couldn't help but overhear the live music and vibrant hum of the crowd from their attached-at-the-hip neighbor, Arguello.  When the person beside me mentioned that she'd just come from there I wrinkled my nose and asked "How was it?"  

Yelp reviews for Arguello had led me to believe that, despite the Traci Des Jardins pedigree, this place wasn't a winner.  With the blessing of this stranger I had reason to see for myself and, $90 worth of food and drink later, I'm in agreement.  Arguello is a fun place serving Mexican fare that goes well with alcohol.  

Arguello has a sweet outdoor patio, indoor tables (which could've used quicker bussing), and a friendly bar.  It was at the latter that I enjoyed a mess of margaritas ($8; alcohol content kicked in at #3), chips/2 salsas/excellent guacamole (about $8), and Frijoles Rosas with Queso Fresco topping ($3.50).  On Cinco de Mayo this constitutes a meal.  

I can't vouch for the larger plates of food with the higher prices as I didn't try them.  Nor can I grouse about the service issues some have spoken of as my service at the bar was quite excellent.  

If I were in the Presidio and someone recommended Arguello for drinks and a little something-something I'd agree without hesitation.  In fact, were I in the Presidio I'd probably be the one making that recommendation.  I'd sit right back down at the bar and order up pretty much the exact same thing (maybe a few less margaritas) and I'm pretty certain I'd leave feeling the same way I felt on this visit.  

Arguello is a good place for drinks and a little something more.
author: Tracey A.

description:
This is a perfectly pleasant place to have a casual, easy lunch. The low rating is seems to be mostly due to reviews from years ago. 
I like it here for a lot of reasons:   There's parking. They have indoor and outdoor seating.  It's located in the cool "Officer's Club" building. You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table, so it's on the casual side, but the value is good and the food is fresh and tasty.  I like their homemade chips with guacamole and salsa.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Had brunch here this morning. Great little hidden gem in the Presidio. Lots of parking which is a plus. Atmosphere is super cute-Spanish style with a big outside patio with lights and cute furniture. They also provide cozy blankets and have outdoor heaters, which makes sitting outside in SF doable. 

We loved everything we tried. The huevos rancheros, taco plate (shrimp and fish) and omelette. For drinks we enjoyed the sangria and boozy cold brew. 

Do note that they don't serve lunch on weekends! 

Will definitely be back for taco Tuesday here!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
I want to like this place.  It has parking. It is reasonably quiet.  It is in a nice building and has an outdoor space.  However, it is just too odd to really recommend.

The menu is very limited and seasonal, so if you like something, it probably won't be on the menu the next time you go.  

They make a big deal about Agave and Spanish wine, and the bar, but don't have Sangria.  Now maybe that is not really authentic Mexico, but a Mexican place here without Sangria is just missing something. 

The food all seems really pretentious, but when you taste it, it is just not that flavorful.  I'm talking about the little Gem Salad with horrible Green Goddess dressing, the deconstructed pork belly tacos, and even the chocoflan.  It was a disappointing meal overall.

Service was fine.  Just wish the food was better.
author: Alan B.

description:
1st time I went was for lunch. Had the Shrimp Tacos and the taquitos! The Shrimp tacos were delicious!!! I highly recommend!!! The service was decent nothing special I have seen better. 

2nd time was for lunch at 2:00pm and hoping to get Shrimp tacos or taquitos for lunch. When I order some the waiter told me that they do not serve tacos for lunch and I could come back at night and the items they served was the only ones in the menu. Bummer! The menu only had basic simple appetizer nothing that would be consider lunch (Salsa & chips, guac and chips, pepita, chicharon) and a variety of alcoholic drinks. Order guac and chips $6.50. 

3rd time went for dinner was craving tacos and went out of my way to show off the place to my boyfriend because is a beautiful location and was just perfect the first time I dined there. WAS NOT WORTH IT!! We left completely disappointed ! No tacos and they had a small menus to choose from. We order food my boyfriends food Mole was bland not much taste to it. I ordered Whole shrimp al ajillo the rice was good the portion was small. We also ordered guac, salsa and chips. Chips were stale and salsa taste like spicy water do not recommend at all. 

Over all it was a good experience decided to go again not great gave it another chance DEFINITELY would NOT come again or RECOMMEND this place!!!

Check out other places SF has better restaurants then this one not worth the time or money!!
author: Iveth R.

description:
Honestly kind of surprised that the reviews for Arguello are so bad!

But I guess I didn't really eat much besides chips and guac and drink! My friend and I came here for margaritas and appetizers before eating at Commissary. The weather wasn't that warm, or else I would've loved to sit outside on the patio! There aren't enough spaces in San Francisco with outdoor seating at all.

Parking here was so easy because it's the Presidio. If you come early, make sure to check out the Presidio Officer's Club right next door! It's a beautiful lodge-y space that feels cozy. It's a public area where you can bring a book to read. There's even a piano!

If I have some sort of birthday or social event, I would consider having here on a warm afternoon!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Service is really warm and friendly, the food is good and I thought the portions were the perfect size! Love coming here.
author: Sarah S.

description: Fantastic place!  Great tacos, great service, and great ambiance.  Large restaurant with plenty of outdoor seating.  You can't go wrong here. I'm definitely coming back ... a lot!
author: Mark S.

description:
This review is for brunch, which is insanely good. Last time I was here I had a bite of my friend's sweet potato and carnitas hash -- he got a poached egg on top-- and it was so good that it has compelled me to write my first review on here in years. Overall the brunch is arguably one of the best in SF-- and it's even better because it seems to be a bit of an inside secret, i.e. you can actually get seated quickly. (I detest waiting in line for brunch.) The portions are not huge, but the quality -- both of the raw ingredients and the preparation-- is excellent. 

Also, I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the cocktails. I don't know why this place doesn't get more buzz for its bar program, the drinks are uniformly superb.
author: Mary B.

description:
Completely disappointing brunch. They don't have the right item selection and the food was mediocre. They say mexican but it's more like half-a vague elements. The table next time mine had a light fixture above that I saw 3 people smack into during the course of my meal. You'd think that would be something that happened once and the restaurant would immediately fix.

Waste of time at this place.
author: Ryan B.

description: I recently reserved the entire patio area for a wedding cocktail hour and was very disappointed with the results. I had conversations with their event coordinator about what I wanted and what to expect but nothing turned out the way it was suppose to. The passed appetizers were slow to come out, at certain times no food at all but their reasoning was that I had too many hungry guests. Guests were also served drinks that I did not order. The food was decent but for the amount I was paying, it was definitely not worth it and I would NOT recommend to large parties due to their service.
author: Maxine C.

description:
Don't go here for  your birthday. Recently went with a group of 6 and one of our friends brought us all cupcakes at the end, which she handed us from a box she kept by her side through dinner. The restaurant charged us for the cupcakes that WE handed to OURSELVES - they didn't even have to hold them in the kitchen for us or cut a cake. It is absolutely absurd to charge a fee where no labor or assistance on the restaurants' end was required. This place has horrible birthday spirit.

All dishes also seem to be missing one ingredient to take them from good to wow.
author: Sara S.

description:
This review is for their drinks, warm fire pit outside and good overall feel.

We sat outside with the dog on a sunny Sat afternoon. Service was good and we had some delicious agave type drinks. Dog was happy too !
We also had great chips and salsa and some guacamole which was excellent. 

Highly recommended:)
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Arguello was a huge disappointment.  We were served margaritas on the rocks with   barely enough salt to taste on the rim. APPARENTLY they were saving the salt for later. No matter the margs were weak and slightly flavored. Not bold and  a citrusy as one would hope. I sent mine back and told them what i wanted: lime juice, triplesec and a better tequila and rocks and salt. They assured me they used fresh lime and triple sec. There was no evidence of lime, perhaps they need MORE and a better triple sec as well. The service was confused and inefficient. They returned with something very like the previous margarita. I did not finish that single margarita in the hour and a half that we were there. Normally I would have shared a pitcher or had three.
We ordered an appetizer, ceviche, it came w no chips, we waited for a return of the waitress, meanwhile we were asked if we'd care for chips and salsa. I thought these were to be gratis and in lieu of the fact we had nobody to take our order. I finally called someone over to take our order. (Btw the chips were not free). After about an hour from the start our order appeared. My wife liked her carnitas tacos. I had ordered the fish. The fish came attractively prepared on a bed of green coloured rice mixture. Maybe cilantro? I could not taste anything in the rice as it was too salty to distinguish. The fish was nicely browned, broiled BUT It was also too salty and laden with grease, butter i think. As small as the fish and green rice serving was, I could not bear to finish it. I asked for some lemon to try to brighten the flavour but it was too far gone. I don't write reviews or consult yelp but i felt the need to object. The bill was 95 dollars without tip. Two drinks, ceviche, $al$a and ¢hip$, tacos, and fish. I left a tip and i don't know why.
Pretty place, plenty of customers, maybe they don't need to try.
author: John H.

description:
Returned for another attempt at receiving good food and service. Failed on both.  The burrito is a joke! The fish tacos were good albeit tiny bits of fish rather than healthy portions. The frijoles con queso came without queso!  Three tiny dollops of cheese and the beans were bland.  (HINT!  HIRE A GREAT LATINO CHEF)

The wait staff has big time attitude! Perhaps this stems from Jardins' Jardinaire training or lack there of! Who knows. 

IMHO I believe Ms Jardins has endeared herself to the Trust who have awarded her three concessions at the Presidio. Her Commissary is exemplary. Her Arquello is not! Neither is her Transit Cafe.
author: Tex M.

description:
We stopped in because of the street corn they have on their web site. Only to find out that it is only a seasonal dish. 
The Cochinita Pibil was bland and tasteless. After adding salt and squeezing lime on it. It still was not good. 
The second taco was beef Guisado (braised) also did not have flavor. 
The decor was the only nice thing about this restaurant.
author: LeTisha B.

description:
3.5 stars

Although I highly recommend visiting Arguello, I don't love it overall. 

The Miami-like weather in the Bay over the weekend warranted an outdoors brunch - my fam and I chose Arguello for that reason. While we enjoyed sitting under the shade in the warm and sunny outdoors, we stuffed ourselves with the delicious guac and chips appetizer. It's a must order. 

The remainder of the food - fish tacos, chicken roll thingies and shrimp tacos were very so-so. In addition, this place ain't cheap - when the bill came, we were surprised how high it was with the little amount of food we ordered. 

I recommend Arguello for a drink and gauc and chips on a nice day.
author: Irina R.

description: Fabulous place to eat. Great service after you place your order at the counter. Started getting busy right after we got there
author: Teri S.

description: This is a fancy Mexican restaurant right next to the Presido Officer's Club in SF. We decided to eat here right after a KQED event.  The food was just okay for fancy Mexican food. Service was a bit slow.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I take back my previous reviews for Arguello when they first opened... things have only gone downhill since then. 

This is a beautiful location and restaurant with so. much. potential. that goes to waste with a boring menu and rude staff. I've been back twice since I first visited, and both experiences were awful -- long waits (40+ mins) for food, rude hostess ("Is it okay to have a dog on the patio" -- "I don't know" / "Do you guys have wifi?" -- "I don't know" -- uhh, you could find out? You work here?). 

Tacos are really small and bland, meat quality is only so-so. In a city filled with outstanding latin american cuisine of all genres (Cuban, Mexican, El Salvadorean, etc) Arguello is way below par for a higher end restaurant (service, price vs. value) and way off on the flavors and portions for Mexican food. 

I want to spend my money at Arguello, I want to be a regular customer, and I want this to be a great restaurant. Get it together! We're here to support you, but your management/owners have atleast gotta try bringing something to the table other than beautiful decor.
author: Laura J.

description: I love the cocktails and the upscale mexican food. Yes, the food costs more than the local burrito shop but it is fresh delicious ingredients with a bit of a gourmet flair. It is so much tastier than the mexican restaurant that took over Beetlenut on Union. The atmosphere is great and they even have an outdoor patio.
author: Ann W.

description: We hosted my mom's memorial at the Officer's Club and the lunch was catered by Arguello. There were 30 of us and we did the taco bar family style. We had steak, pork, and shrimp tacos along with chips and guacamole. The food was amazing. So flavorful and the staff was attentive and efficient. Randalyn, the young woman coordinating or event, was also amazing. It was a great day and having excellent food made it that much better. I'll definitely be back.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Food - 3
Service - 2
Value - 2

We came here because we were in the Presidio and needed a bite to eat before an afternoon of hiking around the area.  We got the pancakes, a fish taco, a shrimp taco and a carnitas taco.  The pancakes were a 4, but the tacos rated a 2.  Service was very inconsistent -- I felt only one of the staff truly cared about our dining experience, one was average and then the rest could have really cared less.  

When I mentioned to a couple of people that they should consider getting toothpicks since carnitas will get stuck in people's teeth, there was no acknowledgement really.
author: David L.

description:
Lots of great things to say about this place, but I would give it five stars just for the passionfruit cheesecake alone. Or five star for the cocktails too, sorry can remember the names but trust the bartender. The cocktails were very tasty, refreshing and different. 
I really enjoyed the ambiance. The building and location are beautiful. Parking is easy and it is peaceful there. Nice to get away from the downtown hustle.
author: Trevis C.

description: It's a bummer that Traci Des Jardins honors her Mexican heritage with such a bland and mediocre restaurant.  i know that she can be a fabulous chef, but this place misses the mark.  Her other Mexican Restaurant, Mijita, is also not very good.  Her French influenced cooking is fabulous.
author: mi m.

description: The service, food and drinks were excellent.  Family friendly.  Attractive and inviting décor.  We'd definitely recommend it.
author: Marie M.

description:
My mentors and I have started a tradition of going to foodie type places and even though this isn't on par with places like Gary Danko, Kokkari, etc., we definitely had a great time. I was a little worried about coming here for dinner because 1) all the reviews were for brunch, 2) the reviews were super mixed (even though I've heard from others that this place was decent). We got there early and were seated right away. Our waiter, Chris, was super patient with us because we had a lot to catch up on but we ordered the brussel sprouts for an app even though it was a side. OMG- super delicious and with the pomegranent seeds they were even more amazing. 

We all ordered different things: I ordered the chicken enchiladas. This was a risk for me because I'm not a fan of enchiladas but they came out to be really good with green sauce and a bit of kick to them. As an Indian girl, I love any kick to my entree so that was great. My friend/mentor got the squash and she LOVED, LOVED it. She was a little worried about the mushrooms (because she's not a fan) but she basically licked the plate and had all of us taste it (it was good but I'm not a lover of squash so that says something). My other mentor got the Beef cheek which ended up looking like pulled pork and tasted delicious- really soft and just great seasoning. As a table, we also ordered the squash and it was perfect because it came with three slices enough for one for each of us. 

We were full but couldn't pass up dessert... so we had the tres leches cake- super moist, soft, and a good finisher to our meal. 

The only "gripe" that I have is that it seems like the chef is a big fan of pomegranates and puts them on a lot of dishes. I'm a big fan of them so i didn't mind but if you don't like them, I can see someone getting annoyed by them. 

It was a great dinner overall and I'm sad that so many people trash this place. My mentors/I had a fantabulous time and it was nice to be in the presidio and explore this area of town!
author: Rachana S.

description:
Pros: Ease of parking, ambience, roomy feel inside, service

Ok: Drinks

Cons: Food.  We ordered 5 dishes for our group.  None of them were good.

I'd probably never go back for food, but maybe for a few drinks.
author: Buddha B.

description: The location is great, and so are the cocktails. The pea empanadas set the bar high. However, they have the worst chilaquiles I have ever had.
author: Rebeca R.

description: We came to Arguello for a company happy hour and had a perfectly lovely time. Pickings are slim in the Presidio, but my Cuba Libre wasn't all ice, the guac was tasty, and our bowls of chips were continuously refilled. What more can you ask for at happy hour?
author: Christina S.

description: Mexican food created with vision and panache in an exquisite historical setting next to the officers club in the Presidio ( the oldest building in San Francisco built in 1776) ~ the menu may be small but the standards in preparation, service & quality are of the highest level. Our server Eric was friendly, knowledgeable and fluent in Espanol ~ and provided us with exceptional service that enhanced our dinning experience. Ambiance, decor, service and delicious food make Arguello a must stop on the San Francisco culinary map.
author: Armando C.

description: My friend who lives part-time in the city had been wanting to try this place, and since we were walking around the Presidio, we chose it for lunch. First of all, I've never been to a Mexican restaurant where you have to pay for chips & salsa! $4.50 for a SMALL bowl of sort of thick, salty chips and 2 underwhelming salsas - 1 red & 1 green which we didn't even touch. We got a "brunch" menu even though it was Sat at noon. Sorry, in my world this is "lunch." Their brunch menu was VERY limited and there just wasn't anything that appealed to me. I usually order shrimp fajitas or a cheese enchilada but they did not have either one of those things. What self-respecting Mexican establishment does not know how to make an enchilada? Hello! That is a staple of Mexican food. I ended up ordering a cheese quesadilla which was BLAND as hell. It was plain white cheese in a tortilla on a side plate and that's it folks. Cheddar would have been better and perhaps the chef could throw in a few finely chopped jalapeños or some diced green chiles. Get a little creative, why don't ya? My friend had avocado toast which looked pretty blah. She said the bread was "nothing" and the salad that came with it was ehhh. Basically, all she ate was the bacon on the salad. The waiter came over to ask how it was and she explained the above and all he could say was "Sorry about that." You'd think he would have taken hers off the check, but nope. We paid over $50 for a very sub-par meal. Honestly, Taco Hell aka Bell would have been better. These people need to go to Javier's on Newport Coast and find out what a really OUTSTANDING Mexican restaurant is all about. I'd be surprised if this place makes it. Surely, there must be some good Mexican places in the Bay Area, but this ain't it people. Save your money and go elsewhere. Trust me on this one. The only reason I gave it two stars is because I like the wood beams on the ceiling.
author: Lisa R.

description:
The brunch here is soo delicious. We had the Chilaquiles topped with an egg. The sauce was a little spicy and the chips were still crisp. Banana pancakes were light and fluffy and whatever they mix with the maple syrup I could not get enough of. 
If you like tequila this is your spot. Their tequila list is very extensive and the specialty cocktail list will make you want  to try them all. 
All in all this will defiantly be one of my regular go to brunch spots.
author: Jenn E.

description:
For happy hour/drinks this place is fine - but the food is not high quality and the menu is very limited. 

The outdoor patio is nice outside and even better on a warm day - but just get a drink, dont go there for food.
author: christina b.

description: Fantastic ambiance.  Very average "Mexican" food and teeny portions.  We actually thought the waiter made a mistake with our order because we were certain there was no way what arrived was truly a lunch.  The place is a good stop if you want to kill some time, but it's nothing to write home about.
author: Sara O.

description: the setting is perfect and the staff friendly but Arguello is not only over priced, it is as Yelp's two star rating denotes: it's meh and i've had better. $23 for a couple of enchiladas that maybe rival the best of the frozen brand on the market is not a meal to die for. San Francisco is expensive but not everything is worth it; that includes the $9 for chips, salsa, and guacamole.
author: David D.

description:
I didn't know about the extremely low rating until I had walked out - I was surprised, but looking back, I can understand where a 2.5 star rating comes from.  Small place when the outdoor patio area is closed (as it was), and a bit disorganized.   There's a line that snakes back from the bar where you order food and then sit down.  The signage could be better.  

I was shocked as to how much everything cost, but you're paying a premium for eating Mexican food in the Presidio, and it was pretty tasty.  For ~$5 per taco, you get a good amount of meat (I ordered the carne asada and carnitas tacos, and my friend gave a good review on the fish taco).  We also got chips/salsa/guac, which was $6.50.  I think chips only were $4, and that's a 1 star deduction immediately.  

Aside: Restaurants, don't be stingy with the chips.  At a cheap dive, fine, limit the chips because your clientele can't afford that much, and they'll just fill up on chips.  At an expensive place like this, people can already afford the entire menu, so why charge a premium for something so cheap? Bad form. 

So, overall disorganization, small portions and high prices, and good tasting food equals out to a 3 star experience.  I might come back for dinner at some point and revisit this review.
author: Ben K.

description:
Delicious brunch, great service, best of class setting and location!

Our group of thirteen arrived at the Arguello after a thrilling six mile glorious hike through the park. We were warmly greeted and seated in the Anza Room, a private dining room.  Service by Erik was prompt and attentive, and we were treated like visiting royalty.  The brunch menu is creative and redolent of old Mexico, and the food was simply delicious.  One favorite were the house made corn chips.  All of us in our party were truly impressed by the Arguello and I know we will be back in the future.
author: Michael R.

description:
The bartender named Matt is one of the most knowledgeable bartenders I've ever come across.

Very classy establishment. The revival of The Officers Club is a great success.
author: Garrett H.

description:
When it comes to this place, dont order a unique dish you have never heard of and expect some gigantic portion with a true Hispanic flair. This is San Francisco people. Go to the mission if you don't want a modern twist on your taco. 

For a good spot to have some amazing margaritas that are perfectly strong, come to this place. They have a heated patio, good aray of food on the menu , and yes there are some pricy dishes but that's to be expected if you come to a beautiful restaurant like this. Do yourself a favor and order the SHRIMP TACOS! I  repeat....order the SHRIMP TACOS.... Best item on the menu hands down. Literally only come here for margaritas and tacos. Highly suggest you do the same yelpers, deffinatly worth the trip.
author: Alexis A.

description: Nice atmosphere, and that's all. Overpriced tacos were severely lacking in flavor. The bland salsa didn't help, no matter how much I used. To make things worse, they charged me BY THE OUNCE to add one shot of whiskey to my coke. It cost me $16 for a single shot (2 oz) of well whiskey. Worst food I've had in San Francisco.
author: Colby W.

description:
I read the Yelp reviews and spoke to a few folks while on our Presidio hike.  Lukewarm reviews both written and verbal.  But we said lets give it a try and see for ourselves.  

Pros - located in the historic Presidio Officers Club; Traci des Jardins stellar rep; fast service once you place your order.

Cons - small portions; overpriced; no reservations; need to place your order at the bar.

The three of us ordered lunch - one carne asada taco, one carnitas taco, one mushroom quesadilla, one order of the jicama avocado salad, one order of chips with guacamole.  One ginger beer, one draft beer, and one Coke.  Total inc tax & tip $63.00.  Obviously we didn't order enough food.  Everyone should have two tacos each.  Who knew they were so tiny.  And the mushroom quesadilla was not your typical Mexican style one that can feed 2+.   This one was so small.  Like a teacup saucer.  With sautéed button mushrooms.  The least expensive type.  At $10.50.  Total ripoff.  

This place is to be avoided.  Felt like a tourist trap.   Was busy though.  Again it must be due to Traci's rep.  She needs to take a closer look and revamp.   I'll never eat here again or suggest to anyone.  

We felt we only had appetizers.  Not satisfying at all.
author: Shirley N.

description: Wow, quite disappointing.  Our server was delightful.   The food not so good.  The guac and chips were tasty.  I had the chicken enchiladas.   They were dry and lacking flavor and lacking cheese!!   The beet salad was also disappointing.   It was plated on some cement-like, flavorless mess.  The dinner menu didn't have the tacos I was hoping for nor did it have the churros.  We had a slice of chocolate cake that was dry.  Honestly a slice of Costco cake would have been much preferred.  I'm sad to write a poor review but this was just lousy and not cheap either.  Coffee was quite good.
author: Pauline C.

description:
Ordered chips and taco appetizers - they came out in a few minutes but tasted like they had been previously frozen and thrown in grease to heat them up - very heavy, very little meat and full of grease.   Chips were ok.

We had been there for an hour and a half before we discovered our main entree had not been started which turns out was a good thing considering the quality of the appetizers.

Our bill was $57.00 for grease taco snacks, a glass of wine and two cocktails.  

Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. 

-going to be hungry.
author: Jay W.

description: Over price, food does not have flavor. Service is slow. Charged me $2 extra for corn tortillas when the menu said it came with tortillas. Menu was small and confusing.
author: Robert G.

description: The hostess silvana was rude and unaccommodating, I would not recommend this place for a big group. They seated others before us that arrived after us, wouldn't put two tables together for us and made us wait a ridiculously long time despite not being full, I am particularly disappointed because we live so close and was hoping we could go here frequently.
author: Maria K.

description: Average food, you'll be paying for location and convenience. Nice location if you're in Presidio and need to eat, stat!  Food is good, but not great and service is good with friendly staff.  Place stays busy on weekends to accommodate tourists in the Presidio.  Nice outdoor seating with fire pit.
author: Shariq H.

description:
I like the setting. I like the ambiance. I like the food. 

We came here for weekend brunch and were happy that we could sit outside, enjoy the great weather and the casual vibe -- without the typical SF hassles related to parking and waiting lists. I had the  Papas Fritas ( 3 way cooked potatoes with a spicy sauce, chicharrones and a perfectly cooked egg on top). Delicious. My companion had huevos rancheros which she found to be a bit underwhelming. 

We didn't try the cocktails but the seasonally inspired list looked interesting. Next time.
author: LH M.

description: We went to Arguello for brunch while on our regular walk through the Presidio. We read several reviews that were mixed at best but wanted to try it anyway given it's proximity to our home. We were pleasantly surprised by the great food and great service. We started with the chips and guac which were very good! We both had the taco plate - it came with two per person - one with shrimp and the other with cod. These were very good as well. We ate on the side patio and enjoyed the surrounding ambiance. Overall it was very good and we look forward to coming back to try the rest of the menu.
author: Michael B.

description:
Another reason why Yelp needs to create negative star options. Perhaps someone ought to erect a petition on moveon.org or change.org. Writing to Yelp may also get this rolling. 

Recently, I learned the Manager abused his authority and prioritized his personal feelings over his professional duties.  He created false accusations that I called him non-profane terms when I informed him his waiter was lagging and incompetent.  He then relayed these false accusations to his boss, Arguello's Owner or CEO.  In so doing, he banned me and a regular small crowd of people from ever making reservations at the restaurant or attending. 

Essentially, if you're looking for good food, decent to great service at reasonable (NOT wild) prices, look elsewhere.  If you dare speak up and demand the basic services every diner is entitled, prepare to suffer backlash or muzzle yourself.  I gather their prices reflect these facts.  Instead of rectifying their faulty services, they keep acting like grunts and charge higher prices to compensate for the disgust they render in diners--prospective, first-timers, regulars.
author: Honest J.

description:
If you are looking for a pleasant spot for meeting some friends in the city, especially if anyone wants to walk around in a beautiful location first, this may fit the bill.  (Or after taking dogs to Chrissy Field!) The outside fire pit is fantastic to have a cocktail and chat. The margaritas tasted fresh and had a decent tequila for their house blend. Parking on a Saturday evening was effortless and free--which is certainly a rarity. The guacamole was fresh but pretty bland, as were the two salsas that were served. The habañero salsa at least brought some needed heat.  The chips were very good. I had the carnitas sopes appetizer ($12) as my meal, and they were tasty, with nice bits of carmelized meat.  Pretty small portion but not outside of expectation. The taco appetizer was also good, though the salsa it came with was again unexciting though fresh. Our friends all had the pork shoulder, which is clearly what is considered their best dish based on waiter recommendation. The presentation of a chunk of meat on one side of an otherwise empty plate, for $23, did not win me over. 
So for the pricing I would like to see better presentation and more interesting seasoning. Otherwise I may return for apps and a drink or two, but there are many other restaurants with much better food with Mexican flavors.
author: Nancy E.

description:
This place gets a 5-Star review for their bar and 4-star for the food, which is out of this world but expensive.

Let's start with the bar - we tried a drink that was hit chocolate and homemade almond milk with some orange, a chili with a hint of smokiness and mescal. It was perfectly balanced and full of nuances. I have never had anything like it. I had the bar make me a non-alcoholic drink and it was the perfect mocktail. Different from anything I had ever had, not too sweet and utterly refreshing. The rest of their drink menu looked incredible and I highly recommend people come here to at least grab a drink. They are worth their $12 price tag. The bar staff are extremely friendly and I recommend sitting at the bar if for nothing else than for the chance to share a laugh with them. 

The tortilla chips are homemade and thick; we got them with guacamole and salsa. The tomatillo salsa was amazing, the red salsa a bit to sweet for my liking. The amount of guacamole was healthy but I would have liked to have been able to add a bit of salt to it. The soup of the day, oxtail $12, plus the sopes ($14) plus chips were perfect for two people for dinner and all of it was very tasty. We didn't order any mains because $22 was a bit steep for the portion size, although they are trying to go for a more upscale crowd which is hard to with Mexican. The prices are higher than Nopalito, my benchmark for this kind of restaurant. However, we live in the Presidio and this is close to home, so we will certainly come again because taste wise, everything was stunning.
author: Kara A.

description:
This review is for the bar as well as food at the bar. While I believe the food is a bit expensive if this were in a hotbed of other restaurants I know rent and locations in the Presidio have to increase their margin to stay afloat. It is a tricky business, this Presidio, for the stream of visitors is challenging to maintain. Without further ado onto the bar!

The barman was excellent. His knowledge of the booze at his disposal was excellent. He had created a hot alcoholic chocolate with Oaxacan flair and almond milk(for those who prefer their cocktails entirely bespoke they had indeed made the almond milk onsite). It was delicious. The compound whipped topping was astoundingly complex and delicious. I found myself making sure I metered my intake of it to ensure it lasted for the entire drink.

My fiancée grabbed a mocktail that he whipped up after asking about flavor preferences. It was tasty, only a tiny bit sweetened, and the color was an impressive shade of purple.

We thought the food was delicious. Their tortilla chips are stout: thick, greasy enough, and the overbearing salt crystallization I have seen at some places was delightfully absent. Their tomatillo salsa is delicious. It is not spicy, it simply showcases the flavor of the tomatillo. A big win. The guacamole is fine. Not a showstopper, but certainly fresh and the presentation was nice. It was easy to extract with the chips, and as a borderline glutton this is a key feature I look for in a serving dish. 

We ordered the carnitas sopes, which were nice and fresh, but did lack a bit of pizazz from the corn sopes upon which the fresh radish, avocado, and beans were served. They were great texturally but were missing something that would have made it an extroardinary dish. The carnitas was lean and delicious.

The soup of the evening was an oxtail soup. Referred to as gallinas but was not actually chicken which the barman explained was the origin of it coming from working class kitchens where oxtail was a more common ingredient. It was as he had explained: savory, flavorful, but not a rich and overpowering dish. The mix of herbs and cabbage on top made a great addition and added a fair bit of complexity and flavor. The oxtail near was delightful, tender, and served on the bone.

As a resident of the Presidio and a fan of Mexican cuisine of all sorts Arguello is a welcome addition to the main post area. I understand that it may lack some finer dining features gourmands in the Bay Area may expect but I found that the charm for me was the bar. I found the drinks the staff created to be unique, complex, and satisfying to my palette. If choosing between a two top seating and bar I would choose bar every time. Certainly worth the experience.
author: James T.

description: Absolutely cannot fathom why their rating is so low. The food was AWESOME! Okay, so maybe not cheap but you get what you pay for. Two entrees an appetizer and two margaritas each for around $100 in SF is not bad at all! Randomly went here twice in a week and it did not disappoint. The first time we sat at the bar and ordered; margaritas, plantains, taquitos, ?corn-cheese-salsa?, and homemade guacamole. Everything we ordered was delicious and I can tell you as someone who grew up in California and has eaten killer Mexican food all her life, arguello nailed it! Second time around we sat at a table and ordered mezcal margaritas, nachos, and drunken chicken. Again, they did not disappoint. The food was so fresh and delectable and the service was impeccable. I can't wait to go back and order the snapper and try the chicken enchiladas, all which looked divine. The service we experienced at the bar and in the dining was top notch! I only wish I remembered the names of the the lovely ladies who helped us so I could give them a proper shout out. Perhaps arguello had a rough start in the beginning, hence the low rating, but I promise you won't be disappointed visiting this wonderful establishment.
author: stephanie c.

description:
Way overpriced for this quality of food. Actually the food quality might not fit any price point. Over cooked shrimp, greasy rice. The salsas and guacamole came to the table ice cold; they obviously just pulled them from a refrigerator. (read: not fresh!)

Seriously, a coupe of drinks, chips and cold salsa, cold guac, and a shared (meh) entree was over $70.

Service was not great. Seemed like a young, untrained staff. They forgot things and didn't bring items in the right sequence.

On par with prices, service and food quality of an average tourist trap.

The whole concept was to honor the historical, Mexican connection to the Presidio. Missed by a mile.
author: Shane G.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant on the bay area hands down. Very professional team, excellent bartender and amazing food
author: Paulo F.

description: We had a thoroughly delightful brunch at Arguello. Our group of 10 tried most of the menu items. All were very good with a few falling into the category of deliciously superb. The sweet potato hash was loaded with a huge pile of perfectly prepared carnitas. The carnitas were surrounded by cubes of sweet potatos and rajas and epazote. As much as I would love to try some of the other offerings, there no question I'll order the hash on my next visit.  Service was professional and prompt.
author: M M.

description: Just went to Arguello and really  I expected more. It has a small menu and it is a small dining area. You order at the counter and they bring your food to you. Shrimp tacos were good, be advised, you get ONE. It is a bit overpriced for that. It was too chilly to sit outside, but on a nice day, quite lovely. Overall, 4 stars for the margaritas, but I would not make a special trip to eat here again.
author: Mary D.

description:
My friends and I were originally planning to head over to the Commissary in the Presidio at 4pm but upon arriving they did not open up until 5pm and it was recommended that the Arguello was open for drinks and bar bites. So we headed on over.

What an amazing happening place in the Presidio!  The Presidio is in need of venues such as Arguello!  Gorgeous restaurant and patio area!  It certainly was a beautiful day to sit on the patio with good friends and have great drinks!  

What made our visit especially special, was Enrique!  He absolutely makes Arguello come to life with his experience and utmost professionalism with a bit of sassiness to boot! With myself being in the hospitality industry for 15 years, it's wonderful to meet good people like Enrique!

What makes me come back to places is not necessarily the food these days but the Exceptional Customer Service Experience and Enrique has it all!  I would highly recommend anyone who is visiting the San Fran area and strolling into the Presidio to check out Arguello!  A MUST in my BOOK!
author: Alison M.

description:
I should have know we were in trouble when we walked in and the host said "what's going on?" When we said we wanted a table for two we were then asked rudely "are you going to eat?" Um no I came in here for giggles. 

The food was decent but pricey. The brunch menu did not offer tons of options. They have an extremely limited choice of beverage that are nonalcoholic and no diet soda of any type at all.  The service to the table was adequate but honest the host was so off- putting I will not go back.

The next time I am in the are and hungry I would have a better experience walking down the street to the Disney museum cafe.
author: Amy M.

description:
We returned again to Arguello this month, and we're disappointed to see that there weren't many changes to the flavors and quality. A bit blah. Even the guacamole was still meh. We ordered the watermelon and jicama salad. It was okay but lacked zip.

On the upside, the margaritas remain a-mazing, the service was great, and the chips were tasty, and the corn on the cob had good toppings. 

I would recommend this pace for chips/salsa and margaritas. 

SUCH a great space and tons of parking. I'm really rooting for this restaurant. We'll give it another go in another few months. Maybe focus groups would help to suss out what's not working?
author: Bing B.

description:
So much potential - location, indoor and outdoor decor - but soo disappointing! Absolutely tasteless and expensive food, and every other item on the menu is fried (including the chips). I had to keep asking for clarification of each appetizer to see if it was fried (and 5 times, the answer was yes).

My friend and I ordered the chard and corn enchilada plato ($19), thinking we could share it, and what came out were two small, ridiculously bland enchiladas with a side of rice and refried beans.

The melon arugula salad also had zero taste, and wasn't as much a salad as it was a bowl of fruit with 2-3 sprigs of arugula thrown on top. 

Only redeeming quality: good cocktails.

Really wanted to like this place, but definitely will not be coming back until a new chef comes along.
author: Katie T.

description:
I'm shocked at the low star rating here; not our experience at all...

When Bautista established the Presidio in 1776 he could not have possibly imagined the new Officer's Club let alone the public restaurant tucked on the west side of the building - Arguello.

"Experience a new restaurant located inside the Presidio Officers' Club offered by the Presidio Trust and award-winning chef Traci Des Jardins. Arguello features Mexican food and drink." Their Web Page Quote

We venture to the City every once in a while to experience some of the best places to eat in the world. Arguello is one of the rare finds tucked away where many would not think to venture, next to the Officer's Club - really? You bet really, Arguello's has an abundance of parking (very rare in the City).

Get out of your car or taxi and smell the ocean air, take a minute and sit in a bench in front of the Club and enjoy a view of the Bay to Angel Island and beyond. Once you have soaked up the ambiance of the Presidio and the Bay head a little bit west and turn right to see large wooden gates leading into a decorative patio with a fire burning, chairs with blankets if it gets cool and a tortilla station where house made treats await you inside.

For some reason Arguello was not crowded this Saturday evening so we were able to sit at their Tequila Bar. I ordered a soda water with a splash of house made orange bitters. Their selection of craft bitters is very interesting and worth exploring if you aren't into liquor, wine or beer at the moment.
