The rest of our party ordered beer and Margarita's, reporting they were excellent. The bartenders are engaging and humorous which always makes for an enjoyable experience.

We were seated promptly with a view of the patio and our server Thomas was right on top of us with reorders of drinks. By the way Thomas, it is a pet peeve of mine when well into our conversation and enjoyment of libations that the server never asks if we would like another round; good job Thomas as you came around several times and asked. Thank you, your service was excellent.

We began with sides of Frijole Rosas, Salsa, house made chips, a green and red dipping sauce and guacamole - well done and presented in pottery befitting of the restaurant's style. Yummy stuff!

The Entrees

whole shrimp al ajillo, cilantro rice: my guest reported this to be excellent.
caramelized pork shoulder, orange-serrano 'pico de gallo', cabbage salad: if you want the best-of-the-best on the menu ask the Maître d', this is what I had to order and it was delicious. The meat was cooked to perfection, served floating in a mildly spiced sauce and ceramic bowl giving you the feel of being in San Miguel de Allende feasting on Mama's cooking. The cilantro cabbage slaw was cooling and a much welcomed side to this dish.

chicken taquitos: my wife reported average, would order the pork shoulder or whole shrimp if she had it to do over again

little green salads: my guests reported okay, both are watching their waste lines, so...

Presidio Arguello is a hidden gem IMHO, a solid four stars IMHO
author: Gary J.

description:
We were excited to try Arguello, mostly because we love Mexican food but also because we imagined that it would be a nice place to walk to on a sunny day.  

We went for lunch on a Friday (TGIF!).  

Let me just boil it down to this.  With its current state of operations, Arguello will be out of business within a year.   While we were on the property, our comments were the following:

"Where do we order?  Oh, over there where that big line is."
(....thoughts of how awkward this place would be on a date)

"Why can't they get their 'order at the counter' operations to be efficient, like they do at the Grove?" (....thoughts of delicious breakfast burrito at the Grove and that I would be going there next time)

"The meat in my tacos tastes like it wasn't seasoned.  This salsa is good.  Is your guacamole good?  No?  Oh, its 'just okay'?  Remember those great tacos we had at Mamacita?" (....thoughts of delicious tacos and guacamole at Mamacita and that I would be going there next time)

"I think those people just got annoyed by the line and left." (....thoughts of the rowdy, fun-loving crowd at Tia Margarita..... and that I would be going there next time)

The place has a ton of potential but they have multiple problems, including the setup, the service (nice people but all overwhelmed by the problematic setup), and the food wasn't good.  As in, we definitely won't be going back or telling anyone else to go there.  F.
author: Holly L.

description: Great place to enjoy beautiful views, good food and pleasant
author: Natasha K.

description:
Came here for brunch on Saturday all by my lonesome. Thought it'd end up being a boring brunch but thanks to the great staff, it was one of the best brunches ever!

Sat at the bar and received excellent service from Carla, Nate, and Thomas. Ordered up some drinks which were all excellent and made my Saturday so much more pleasurable. For food, ordered the huevos and some chips, salsa, and guacamole which satisfied my tummy :)

Overall - Whole staff was warm and welcoming and made my time there memorable. Food was amazing. Will definitely be coming in again soon!
author: Krizia O.

description:
I've eaten here 4 times now.
The good is that their chips are crispy and some of the best I've had. And their house margarita is strong and has a smokey sweet flavor. Quite good.

The bad is that they just don't have their sh*t together. Long waits when more than half the tables are empty- no I asked, most are not reserved.
Inefficient and rude staff. I was here on 4/2 for my bday and they are just not accommodating. To add to this the waiter thought we short changed him which we did not. 
I LOVE Mexican food. All kinds. But this menu is very limited and the portions are very small. 
Sorry I won't be coming back. Too many other excellent Mexican food restaurants with better service, and a more appealing menu. In the marina alone which is the closest neighborhood they have 3-4 really quality, fun and friendly full sit down Mexican food restaurants. 
The owners need to close, fire the chef and staff and reinvent themselves fast!
author: Jon D.

description:
Three of us had lunch here today. Big mistake! I will start off by saying that I think Traci des Jardins is spreading herself too thin. A month or so ago, a friend and I had lunch at Commisary which was very disappointing - so-so food and amateur service.  So, bravely, we did lunch at Arguello.  First of all, the young lady taking orders set me off by telling me to  "stand over there, not here" to place my order! My response was, "sorry, but no one gave me an instruction booklet when I walked in". 

Anyway, we ordered and since it was a beautiful day, I spotted a shady table in the patio so could dine outside. We walked out and the table was dirty! It was obvious that it was not cleaned up after the diners who had just been there. The dishes had been cleared but the table had not been wiped down. So we sat inside.

The orders came -  one.  at.  a.  time. I was  done eating my first taco before the 3rd person at our table was served! The food was very bland and almost tasteless and luke warm. My fish taco was about a 4 inch taco with a piece of battered deep fried fish on it the size of my thumb. We all had the fish taco and we all decided that it cried out for salt, even though non of us are major salt eaters. My carne asada taco had 3 small strips of beef. They were tasty but after 3 bites, it was all gone. 

Traci (may I address you by your first name even though we have not met?) get your self over there and start cracking the whip. Get some professionalism imbued in your people there, increase the size of your portions and make the food tasty. $4.50 for a fish taco that is about 3 bites is not a good value. As for flavor, I can think of several Mexican restaurants in the Mission District that have delicious food and reasonably priced. Get with it, Traci !!
author: Tom B.

description:
This is my first Yelp review, and I hate the fact that it is negative in nature, because I am not a negative person.  My husband and I were staying at the Inn at the Presidio, so we thought Arguello would be convenient as it is just a short walk down Moraga.  The decor is very nice, but that's about the only positive thing I can say.  We were seated quickly, and ordered a glass of wine, two cocktails, one taco appetizer to share and chips and salsa.  We also ordered our main entree at the same time.  

Appetizers came out pretty quickly, and the chips were just so-so, a little greasy.  The 5 little tacos were tiny, hard fried and greasy, with barely any meat in them.  The bowl of chips was small, and the salsa portions were tiny.  

After about an hour and a half, we found out that the kitchen had not even started our entree, and there were only about 5 tables left in the restaurant at that point.  We cancelled the entree order, paid our $57 bill and left.  We definitely felt like the stereotypical "trapped tourists".   It's a shame that a location like the historical Presidio Officers Club is not being honored with a good restaurant.  Time to call in Chef Ramsey.
author: Mary K.

description:
Great Mexican food can be had elsewhere.  I had the tongue, and when I ordered it I thought "that's pretty brave to have tongue on your menu"  They must know how to prepare it well,  It was bland and hard.  Take that tongue off the menu.

Prices are too high for the boring food. Good Mexican food should be complex and interesting with flavor.  This place misses the mark.  I would be willing to pay the price if the food was awesome, but it's not.  Either improve the quality of the food to match the price, or lower the prices to match the quality.
author: Naomi T.

description: Stopped in for lunch here and it was delicious! Had the pozole and an order of chips, guac and salsas. One or the other would have been a filling lunch! The pozole was super flavorful and the guacamole was the best I've had at a restaurant in quite a while. Just enough spiciness added in to make it delicious! Am looking forward to trying dinner and brunch here.
author: Isla F.

description:
Arguello doesn't take reservations. At all. Alright, fine we'll show up a little early on a Friday night and grab a drink at the bar while we wait.

We showed up by 6:30, there were a few tables open, lots of people waiting to be seated so we went to the bar. Luckily there was 1 stool available for me to sit, but unfortunately it was located right behind a huge column that is towards the end of the bar, which made it hard for staff to see that I was eager to order a margarita. 

I noticed that a long line was forming at the other end of the bar to order drinks, which I found unusual because I've never seen that before. Usually you just flag a bartender down wherever you can. After about 25 min of waiting, we were able to order our drinks.

Long story short, service is very slow and unorganized. We ended up sitting at the bar for dinner, as the seat next to me opened up and the host never called our name to be seated. 

One thing I did appreciate was how fast our food came out once we ordered it. However, please don't roll the tortillas in that paper! Mine stuck to the paper and pieces of it flaked off and stuck to the paper...sigh.

The food is alright, good but not Nopalito good (sorry but it's true), which means it's overpriced. Nopalito doesn't take reservations either but somehow they have their act together.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
1-star for being open at 3pm on Sunday. And 1-star for decent chips and guacamole.

All the rest of the food was pretty much the definition of "meh." And the service was  terrible. We ordered 3 huevos rancheros, with one of them vegetarian. They came out all vegetarian, and the waiter asked one person at the table to "taste them all" to figure out if they were the same or different. They were all the same, but when he asked the kitchen, they lied and said that two had meat.

The pitcher of margaritas was also a bad deal - more like 3.5 than 4 glasses, even with a lot of ice. Also lipstick on glasses and a chipped bowl for the baby. No thanks!
author: Jess W.

description: We celebrated Mother's Day here and it was such a nice treat.  Everyone agreed that the space is beautiful and the food is tasty and clean.  My father in law is from Mexico and requested we come here because the chilaquiles were the best he ever had.  I think the guacamole and chips are enough to make you quite happy.  Beautiful space, yummy food, family friendly.
author: L. P.

description:
I have a hard time understanding negative reviews for this place. We came on a REALLY sunny and beautiful Saturday for lunch. There was a wait, but we really enjoyed ourselves with a drink at the bar, and the bartender was so cute and fun.

I wanted to order the shrimp tacos but they were out... but I wasn't really disappointed or surprised because it was really packed there on such a nice day, and they had a lot of other great menu items I wanted to try. I got the taquitos and they were great.

This is a nice Mexican restaurant with great décor and a friendly staff. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
I never write reviews, but this meal was so incredibly bad I feel the need to warn you all- my husband and I could not think of any worse restaurant experience though we eat out very often. We concluded that it is truly the most disgusting meal we have ever been served. 

After not being able to get into Commissary, we tried Arguello. Chips, salsa and guacamole were edible, but not great. Then things got really bad- the mushroom quesadillas were cold, salty, and the home made tortillas were dry and flavorless. It is also a very small portion (though so gross we would not have eaten anymore) served on a large plate- presentation on everything is bad- salsa bowls so small you can not dip your tortilla chip (which were greasy and bland). We had a side of beans that were also terribly salty (I tend to like a lot of salt, but across the board everything was too salty and lacking any depth of flavor or balance. ) Next came the little gem salad- how is it possible to screw up such a simple salad? Again salty, needing acid. The radishes were limp. 

The grand finale was the roasted squash plato. Inedible, swampy over cooked squash in a watery base with the worst tortilla I've ever had. One bite was enough to get our check and go. 

Traci De Jardins should be horrified to be associated with this place. The team there desperately needs to go to Mexico for some inspiration. Or go to any good taqueria or to Tacolicious
author: Louise H.

description: The tortilla chips are homemade and delicious! As a vegetarian I found so many food options that were amazing! Melon salad and enchiladas were my favorite. The staff was kind and friendly. Offered to make other dishes vegetarian as well. Beautiful atmosphere and vibe!
author: Lauren H.

description: My husband, my son, and I had a truly delicious brunch at Arguello a couple Saturday's ago. We shared the sweet potato & carnitas with a poached egg and the chilaquiles. They were both outstanding and plentiful. Easy enough for  another person. We also had a boozy cold brew cocktail that was so good I'm trying to figure out how to make it myself. The location is really beautiful including the restaurant and the museum within the club. We're definitely coming back.
author: Cecilia T.

description:
Arrived with our baby for dinner at 4:57.  The host suggested that we grab a drink at the bar, because they don't start seating until 5... Ok, fine.  We order drinks, turn around, and there is a LINE to sit down, and 80% of the tables are already full!   We then had to wait in line and snagged the last table.  A heads-up by the host would have been helpful, since we would have waited 3 minutes for a table, rather than chance it at the bar, per his suggestion!!  Service was slow, probably because we were seated last...   2 hours later, we finally left with a screaming and tired baby in tow.

Margaritas were served in a tiny glass and weren't even filled to the top (they were 3/4 full)!  Tasty, but tiny.  Food was mediocre at best.  Shrimp dish was served with the shell on, and no discard bowl... A better description on the menu would have been helpful, because I would have avoided the shrimp, had I known that my fingers would smell the entire night.  No kids menu, despite one being advertised on their website.
author: Marilee S.

description:
I recently had lunch at Arguello and arrived around 12:30pm.  I thought this was an order from your table restaurant, but instead you get your own seat and then stand in line to order from the side of the bar.

After placing my order (for 2 people) which was two tacos, a salad, a quesadilla, coke, and juice, it took the servers 10 minutes to even bring out our drinks. The server fumbled my coke and some of the soda spilled on the floor.  So he left the juice and said he would be back with a new coke.  10 minutes later he came back with the same bottle of coke he dropped (it was just over half full since he spilled it on the floor) and proceeded to tell me it didn't fall on the floor so he was just giving me the bottle back.  I obviously told him to get me a new full bottle, which took him 5 more minutes.

While this soda debacle was going on, some of our food arrived.  However, my quesadilla was not delivered. I waited about 10 minutes and asked where the rest of our order was.  The lady at the register said it wasn't her issue, but she would go ask the kitchen.  After 5 minutes of talking to the kitchen and server, she came back and said it's on its way.  About 8 minutes later it arrived at the table, but the person that came with me had already completed their meal since it took forever for my food to arrive.  

It's important to note that in-between all this time it took to get my soda and food the bartender and server were basically chit chatting behind the bar, cursing, and not really doing much of anything.  It should have literally taken the server 30 seconds to grab me a new bottle of coke, open it, and walk it to my table.

The quesadilla was very small, maybe 4 inches in diameter, but it costs almost $11!!!!  Definitely not worth the price, but it was good.

I give this place 2 stars entirely based upon the extremely poor service.  The food for lunch is OK, nothing special and definitely nothing that would make me want to go there for lunch again.  I may try dinner, but if I have to stand in line to order food from the bar for dinner I will not stay.
author: William B.

description:
Very good food. Very. Good. Food. But restaurant is not only about food.
There are a lot of small things that I value and this restaurant do not have them.
1. They serve only "coffee", no latte, espresso of cappuccino. Shame on you!
2. They have breakfast in the morning but they do not have option of coffee and dessert. They suggested popsicles for us as a dessert. Seriously?
3. In the dinner time their beautiful outside area is only for guacamole and drinks, not for dinner, very sad.
4. Long waiting for every meal. We came with toddler and it was tough to sit through dinner.
author: Tatiana A.

description: Surprisingly great brunch!! The reviews here would indicate that if you come for anything other than brunch this spot may not be the best. But for my one and only experience here I was shocked this place didn't have 4.5 or more stars as the food quality was great and the service was fine (and I'm picky with the quality of Mexican / Latin food that I eat).
author: Art W.

description:
Came here on Friday night with another couple. No idea that it had opened in the Presidio! Restaurant itself is pretty cute - you walk through the back patio that has a fire pit and plenty of blankets for those that want to dine out back.  We walk into the restaurant and check in with the host to put our name down for about a 30 minute wait.  

We are finally seated and decide to order the pitcher of margaritas, mushroom quesadilla and chicken taquitos. Of the two appetizers we all really enjoyed the chicken taquitos and thought the mushroom quesadilla was just alright.  For the mains we had the shrimp dish and pork carnitas.  I really enjoyed the shrimp dish (full head and shells on) however it was quite salty. My hubby enjoyed the carnitas as well.  For dessert we all shared the rice pudding type of dish and churros.  

Overall the food was just okay - a few comments that we all had dining. 
- taquitos only come in 3. We asked that a fourth be added so everyone had one and our server just said they are only made in threes.  Huh? 
- chips and salsa - should always be complimentary! I mean how much does it cost to offer chips and salsa to customers!?! 
- such a long wait between the appetizer course and our mains.  I mean a really long time.  We didn't complain as our server let us know and they did comp us dessert.  
- margarita pitcher was $40! I thought that was a little steep in price.  Our group was not impressed with them either. 

Overall our waiter was great but the above points do not make me want to come back anytime soon.
author: Julie F.

description: food is excellent-fish tacos, their overall take on fresh, local ingredients with a cal twist on Mexican cuisine.  Service has also been excellent, on my two visits.  Like the space, too-but wish the kitchen stayed open past 9.
author: Don T.

description:
One of the worst service experiences of dining out in years. We went for dinner the week after it's grand opening and clearly they had not worked out any of the major kinks in food service. 

The Hostess was probably one of the worst I've ever dealt with. After taking our number to call us when our table was ready, we informed her that we were going to grab a drink and sit on the patio until our table was available. After grabbing a drink, we sat directly outside the door about 10 feet away from her for 45 minutes. After 50 minutes went by, I went up to her and asked how much longer the wait would be. She then proceeded to tell me that they gave our table away because we didn't answer the phone when she called. "We have a ten minute grace period. Sorry." WHAT! ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I was looking at you through the door the entire time. I'm sorry, either that is just ignorant or plain lazy to not walk 10 feet and tell the patron their table is ready after being told. 

Another highly irritating experience I had was with their bartender when we went to order a drink to wait. My friend and I both ordered a glass of wine. Instead of a standard 4 to 5oz pour, he served us nothing more than 2.5oz. I was in disbelief when he gave them to us and charged $24 total. I don't know what kind of establishment they are running over there, but clearly ripping people off is high on their priority list. 

After the seriously frustrating series of events that transpired, we walked out of the restaurant and went to The Presidio Social Club down the street. Thank God there is one well run Presidio restaurant with great customer service and amazing food. 

Don''t waste your time or money on this place. They have A LOT of work to do. 

Friends of mine even went last week and told us it was pretty awful.
author: Simone L.

description:
Another Traci Des Jardins disappointment! I'm not sure why I keep trying her restaurants. They continue to disappoint. Maybe it is because I loved Rubicon when it was around and had an OK meal at Jardinière. But the food at all of her other restaurants is just plain bland.

I was especially shocked when I went to Arguello. I ordered the chicken taquitos for $10. What came out was 3 taquitos with a bit of bland green sauce and sprinkles of bland white cheese (that's it!). They tasted and looked just like the frozen ones that you can get at Trader Joe's or Costco. I couldn't believe they have the gall to charge $10 for these. To top it off, I asked the waitress for some salsa or hot sauce to give them some flavor (because they were so bland) and she told me there is a surcharge for any hot sauce. I can't believe I just paid $10 for 3 taquitos with no flavor, and now you want to charge me more to finally add some flavor.

I seems that a lot of other people have the same view as the restaurant was only 1/2 full for brunch while all the nearby restaurants had a line out the door at the same time.

Never again - I give up on TDJ restaurants.

As an aside, it is a beautiful space and location. Hopefully someone else will move in there and start serving some flavorful Mexican food. There is a ton of demand for good Mexican food in the area.
author: Mary W.

description:
I'll give them 2 stars instead of 1 in hope that it'll get better.

The menu is seriously limited, and seriously overpriced. Four entrees? That's it? $3.5 for chips and salsa that's free everywhere else?

The food was good, I don't care about authenticity, I just want well-prepared food, and the snapper I had was delish. So were the overpriced chips, about which we were told there was only "one free refill" on the chips. Not the salsa of course, that was another $1.5 for more. That was the main problem with Arguello: small carefully controlled portions that make it oh-so-obvious that they're about pinching pennies and not about your dining experience.

And it was virtually empty yet still really noisy, I can't imagine what it's like on a full night!
author: Rob C.

description:
Bland bland bland.  The food here is not seasoned, spiced, or Mexican, Spanish, or adventurous.  One thing it is is overpriced.  
Our table tried enough to get a spherical view of the menu, and everything needed something- some kind of help.  Did I mention that the food here is bland?  We all left feeling incomplete and ripped off. 

When we showed up and got a table, we asked for a highchair and were told there were no highchairs available.  We dealt with it and the kid squirmed in my wife's lap. FIVE MINUTES later I see her bringing a highchair in and set it down around the corner.  It wasn't passed to another table with toddlers, it was put away.  I stared at it and wondered why she didn't offer it to anyone of the numerous families with toddlers.  My goodness- In San Francisco you live an alternative lifestyle if you have children.
author: Sam L.

description:
It's a few days old, so ignore the cranky Yelpers sniping a place that is still dealing with a brand new baby and figuring out operations. The people that go to a brand new place to review it negatively must live miserable, lonely lives.

One of the most beautiful rooms I've ever been in, inside the San Francisco city limits.  It's immediately one of my favorite places in the entire Bay Area.

The bar is beautiful and has about 50 tequilas. You can watch them make tortillas.

The food is so fresh. The tortillas made on the spot. The sauces don't carry too much heat, but therly are some of the most delicious sauces I've ever had my life. Like the new trend, you pay for the servong of chips, but it's a gigantic amount, freshly made (oil dripping), and more than worth it. All the food we sampled was delicious from some of the appetizers to all the tacos, there isn't a complaint to be had.  What's more.... I know I'm going to be back again and again and again and again. It's rare that I know I have a new regular spot within seconds of entering and experiencing the place. But the atmosphere, the history, the art, Andy Goldsworthy art piece out back, it's just amazing. Oh yeah, Tracy's food is unbelievable as well.

Also, more about the building:

An unbelievably special building, I encourage everyone anywhere near the Presidio to check it out. They just nailed historic preservation and its presentation to visitors. The Presidio Trust, the historic architects, the general contractor, and everyone involved should be really proud. It's stunning.  The art, on top of the museum displays, is absolutely stunning.  I was absolutely emotional and blown away going through the building.

The building itself was restored with such loving care it reminds me of a Smithsonian West, really nailing the museum quality, and is deeply relevent to our city's history. It's just stunning addition to the United States, let alone the city of San Francisco, or Presidio. It is bigger than just "us".... This is a shining light for the United States to actually get history right, for once. 

Peter McIntyre:
"I have no doubt that architecture is the highest form of art that we could possibly have. And any architect that manages to build a worthwhile building has my absolute admiration because I know really how much he or she must have gone through to actually design that building." 

I've really loved the 140 New Montgomery project, and the job they did there was magnificent. 

But, it's true, that I haven't felt so unhinged with emotion in relating to a building as "experience" as I have with the Officer's Club. Not in a long time.  It just kept peeling back new moments, with unexpected depth. The new Goldsworthy is stunning. It's just so amazing... we are all ending up immersed, totally steeped, in one of the greatest cultural sites in America at this intersection of history, architecture, art, and interpreting all of that.  The 40 feet of 100's years of history, interpreted in the front museum room, was just spectacular.  Arguello is totally jaw dropping... best room in the city!

Now, for some fun & perspective on people that don't "get it".... Here are 1 star Yelp reviews of National Parks over beautiful pictures:
http://imgur.com/gallery/bwsrB
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
There is nothing to be impressed about here, so I have to chime in as any 5-star review is probably left by their friends and family.  

First what was great -- patio, ambiance, wine and beer menu.  Greatness ends.

Simply, any cantina in the Mission stomps this place.  Actually, any Mexican restaurant in the city limits will give them a run.  $106 for 3 adults and 2 kids.  And hungry afterwards. 

Service was horrific.  Yes, they have been opened only a few days, but there's no excuse for tables to go un-bussed for 10-20 minutes with a 45 minute seating wait time.  Eventually I think the Manager bussed the tables -- he wasn't doing much actually, so good thing.  They must have a "system" -- wait person takes order, then 2-4 other people serve the dishes.  If they remember what you ordered.  Wrong beer.  No appetizer.  Food comes cold.  Or not at all.  Various people coming to your table with confused instructions and wrong dishes.  Did you order this?  No.  Did you order that?  Nope.  Oh well.

Now a word about quality -- and quantity.  I don't expect gourmet micro-dishes from any Mexican restaurant.  "Platos" were tiny, itty-bitty.  Did not come with the corn tortillas as advertised on the menu (they "forgot").   Pollo Chile Verde was a leg and a thigh -- disappointing for $15.  The caramelized pork shoulder was terrific -- but cold, and a very small portion for $18.  Kids menu burrito was mostly tortilla -- kid was not happy.  Adults and kids hungry and $100 poorer.
author: Enrich S.

description: OK this place is starting to grow on me. The food is still not spectacular and requires a bit of punching up but I keep going back for the drinks. The bar is excellent. Enrique and Andi are a perfect blend of attentiveness, friendliness, and unintrussive. Can't beat the ambience. This place is still a bit new and working out the kinks, but I look forward to see how it grows.
author: Matt A.

description:
We dropped in on a Sunday by chance as we were looking to the Andy Goldsworthy Mudball sculpture( I'm a big Goldsworthy fan) after seeing Tree Fall. 

I liked my margarita (the classic, too much lime for my husband's taste but that is the way I prefer them.  I had the fish taco and side of beans, The taco is on the small side but I was happy with the flavor. My husband had the burrito. It was also on the small side. You definitely need to order sides. Also they did not have flan or any other dessert.  For the price I would like a bit more food.  

The place is beautiful though.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Disappointing based on all of the hype and the amazing location! Went for lunch. Didn't know that there was no table service until getting there. Had to order at the bar and it wasn't clear what you needed to do until we asked. 

The lunch menu is limited. I ordered the mushroom quesadilla and my friend had two different tacos plus we each had the jicama salad. The quesadilla was very small but good. The jicama salad was more generous in size and good. Was surprised that they didn't have Diet Coke which is a staple while eating Mexican food. 

The place was nice but definitely not as nice as I had expected. I really think it's way overpriced for the quantity and the service was mediocre. The location is fantastic and I'm very surprised that this is the type of restaurant that went into this historic San Francisco location. If something doesn't change, I'lll be surprised if it survives.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Arguello was an interesting experience - cool setting in the Presidio within an indoor national park, great décor, nice outside eating area available for a warm day and quite spacious. Service was attentive, though not terribly warm. We were never offered a dessert menu (I wasn't that excited by the menu when I'd seen it when we ordered entrees, but would have been nice to receive it), though water was refilled regularly, which is something I appreciate. Parking was generally not that easy to find, though it was Off the Grid in the Presidio, so it's probably easier otherwise. 

Food and drinks were both delivered promptly. We didn't do a thorough check of the menu beforehand, but vegetarian options were a bit lacking (on their website, I only saw dinner and lunch menus, no brunch, which is what we went for). Generally, dishes were on the smaller side. Prices were not outrageous, and generally matched the size of the dishes, but we left a bit hungry.

We had:

Passion Fruit Agua Fresca - Delicious - a perfectly sweetened drink without being too syrupy. A fantastic, fresh taste of passion fruit. I wanted more when the drink was done!

Companions had two grapefruit-based cocktails. Both drinks were almost overwhelming in taste and small, of a mix of alcohol and grapefruit. I didn't enjoy the drink, and my dining companions only felt mediocre about them.

Chips and Guacamole/Salsa - The guacamole had some good chunks of avocado and was definitely freshly made. Not a huge serving (similar to the below), but enough to be easily shared between two people. The red salsa had a nice kick to it. Chips were crunchy and well-salted without being greasy.

Huevos Rancheros - Followed the small theme. About two (maybe three) small, round tortillas were laid flat on the plate, with two poached eggs atop them. There was a semi-spicy salsa/sauce on top, which was the highlight of the dish. A small pile of refried beans were on the side of the dish. Flavors were fine though nothing special.

Oaxaca squash quesadilla - Two medium-sized quesadillas. There was a fair amount of sautéed squash inside, which I enjoyed, (not too greasy, etc.), but the cheese was a bit stringy and bland. Again, nothing wrong if you dipped it in some salsa, but also not fantastic.

I wouldn't rush back soon.
author: Jackie W.

description:
Well, we decided to pop into Arguello while perusing around off the grid.  Thought, why not grab a few cocktails and sit on the patio. The restaurant, especially the outdoor space is very chic and comfortable and staff seemed friendly (somewhat).  The menu is limited, but we weren't there necessarily for the food, so didn't pay much attention.

So, why the 2 stars?  I head to bar to grab two signature cocktails.  For $13, I thought they would be made "fresh". Instead, they were pre-made and poured from a bottle.  Himmm....maybe I'm naive and this is done on a regular basis, but something just didn't seem right about seeing them pour this drink.  And for $13, really?  Not to mention the glass they used was tiny.

Won't be going back to Arguello.  If not for the ambiance and based solely on the drinks, giving one star would gracious.

Sorry!
author: J J.

description:
A beautiful space - comfortable and cozy.
The host was very accommodating to our party of six and waiter was great.
Major complaint is that the food overall was very greasy... Not the fresh Mexi-Cali I was expecting. 
Would I go back, yes - to see how it develops.
author: Tobey N.

description:
Meh. Homemade chips run from burnt to soggy. $10 margarita doesn't come close to the competition. And while I am fine with paying more for haute Mexican cuisine, this place missed the mark. Staff is friendly and professional.

Food: 3 star
Service: 5 star
Space/Atmosphere: 5 star
Value: 1 star
author: Saul E.

description:
The food is amazing!! The price point is a great deal for organic and fresh ingredients, and the entrees are big enough to be shared by two. Cocktails are delicious, too, and their arroz con leche dessert tastes even better than my grandmas recipe!

The service side does need work, but keep in mind this restaurant isn't even a year old, they need time to make changes to get the flow going. I'd also recommend dinner service, lunch service is more tailored to cater to the employees inside of the presidio. A great restaurant in the making, be nice Yelpers, nothing is perfect right off the bat.
author: Katie L.

description:
Beautiful patio 
Drinks nice
Food ( chips/guacamole, pork taco, shrimp taco & chicken taquito) all lacked flavor.  Did not feel good after eating here.
Service still in start up mode.  Hostess needs to be replaced (sort of rude).

Bottom line:  go for a drink and the patio.  Skip the food.
author: David O.

description: We held our Farewell Brunch the day after our wedding here and the food was delicious, the staff was helpful and the bar was flowing! We had reserved the outside patio for 50 and they arranged the tables and food and had some "leftover" heat lamps they put out from another event because the day was so cold and foggy. We could not have been happier with the event and our guests continue to compliment us on it.
author: Linda H.

description:
I've eaten here several times. It has been my favorite food place in the Presidio for several months, and up until today everything has been great. Today I had the mushroom quesadilla, and what a disappointment. The flavors were good, mushrooms and cheese had great texture, but the tortillas up top and on the bottom? Could barely be cut by a fork, and because the thing was thick and fluidy, clearly not meant to be eaten by hand. The thing was obviously overcooked and because of the petrified tortillas, almost inedible. Unfortunately I had another destination and didn't have time to talk to anybody about it. Very disappointed. I will go back because it'
s better than the new menu at the Disney Museum, but now I wonder where I will eat in the Presidio (which is a frequent destination for me).
author: Anne S.

description: Consistently bad. Really want to like it as it is convenient. Service and food all need much improvement. Got a whole pod of jalapeño seeds in our guacamole. Mouth on fire. Couldn't even drink my margarita and they still charged me for it. Done -- will not be back.
author: Sarah T.

description: Good taquitos, excellent guacamole and chips, drinks are good. Fast service and nice ambiance
author: Bill A.

description:
The Officers Club is a good concept - similar to mcmenamins in portland.  
We had high hopes for Arguello.  The margaritas were good. 
Guacamole was plan and house salsas mediocre. 
Service was very slow but understandable for a new restaurant.
Cactus salad was just not good but maybe I dont like cactus. 
We ordered the fish tacos which was $4 for 1 taco but they were out of fish so they put 2 shrimp in which was not good at all.  The ceviche was a bad idea as it was drenched in red cocktail sauce.  Pork shoulder was ok.  Flan was heavy. 
I think this place has potential with the outdoor patio and great ambiance and location with parking but really wish we had gone to the hipster food trucks on the presidio lawn with the fireplaces and tents and spent $20 instead of $100 at Arguello.
author: James M.

description: Can't figure out why this place doesn't have more stars.  Started with surprisingly  prompt Sunday brunch seating.  Just beat a big crowd by arriving when they opened at 11.   The coffee was excellent (maybe a tiny hint of cinnamon?).  Then we had the huevos rancheros which were great -- very flavorful and you could still taste each ingredient, and the eggs cooked perfectly. And then the amazing banana pancakes.  Wow.
author: Mary V.

description:
This place has a lot of potential but isn't quite there yet. The food was good and the portions were generous.  It's also not super expensive, pretty reasonable for the atmosphere/quality.  I have had lunch and dinner here.  

Lunch is order at the counter and have it brought to you.  We sat outside and had a good experience with that.  

Dinner was where the kinks came out.  No reservations and it gets really, really busy.   You could tell the waitress herself was good but she was seriously overextended and had too many tables.  I am giving it four stars because I hope it was just an off night when they were too lightly staffed.

Otherwise food and drinks were great and the atmosphere is nice and lively.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Nicole D H.

description: Prices are good and ingredients top notch but they always run out of stuff like shrimp tacos.  Hostess was the most clueless I've seen in a while...hired her for looks maybe.  Drinks heavy on Tequila very expensive and bar service slower than molasses.  Manager runs around a lot but does not see things.  They servers seem to try to please but system is almost non-existent. Most discombobulated dining experience I've had in a long while.
author: Gregory C.

description: I am blown away (and really surprised) by the amount of negative reviews on Arguello.  Sure, if you are looking for your typical Mexican or hole in the wall burrito place, this is not your place.  However, if you want an incredible (and pretty authentic) meal that is exquisitely presented and tastes excellent....come here.  We were a party of 6 (2 kids) and tried 5 different entrees between us.  Every single one was absolutely excellent, fresh and delicious.  The chips, salsa and guac are delicious, as are the margaritas (mine had fresh crushed blackberries).  I can't wait to come back for happy hour.  Service was great as well.  Prices are on par for what I'd expect at similar restaurants, but again, not the hole in the wall burrito place.  If you love amazing Mexican food, Arguello should be high on your list.  This is going to be a new staple of ours - I am only sorry we haven't come sooner!
author: Coco L.

description: If the portions were slightly larger, and they included chips and salsa or rice and beans with their finely prepared entrees, I would definitely give Arguello five stars. I went in for a late lunch due to a busy day at work. Being beset by hunger pains, I could have used a hearty meal. The mushroom quesadilla I ordered and the hibiscus tea were excellent. The button mushrooms even had the stems removed! The small corn tortillas were partially filled with feta cheese and a variety of mushrooms. It just was not enough to satisfy me and I left the restaurant still hungry and fifteen dollars poorer.
author: Ken R.

description: Overpriced for what it is and the service is slow. You're better off going to the mission.
author: Tiffany L.

description: A friend and I needed some sustenance and came here for some snacks before dinner. We sat at the bar and were attended to by the fabulous bartender Andi was affable, friendly, helpful and genuine. We had a GREAT time just sitting, talking, and snacking. The chips and guac were very good, both were fresh and delish. We didn't stay for dinner, but if you need a break after exploring the Presidio, come and rest a bit with Andi, you won't regret it!
author: Thalia F.

description: Please........We try very hard to like this place because you have an amazing location! You have a beautiful deco and outdoor seating. Who closes at 9???????? What kind of bar? Closes at 9!!! Maybe 10 would be reasonable during the week. Seriously!
author: Ichi Y.

description: I had high expectations for Arguello but came away sorely disappointed! The food was just not good. The amaranth salad could not have had a more uninviting presentation and was mediocre to taste; guacamole so-so; their glasses of wine are more like half glasses. Service good but cannot make up for poor quality paired with 'healthy' prices. We didn't venture into meat dishes (as vegetarians). I really expected more from a Traci J restaurant.
author: susan h.

description:
Overpriced.   I expected, for the price, good food, but now.  I got two tacos, chips and 2 salsa.  The meat was dried out, like it was overcooked and the tortillas were packaged ( not fresh).   For the salsa, they filled up he 1/2 cup size ramekin  1/2 full. For$5 I expect the ramekin to be full, especially since it's so small to begin with.   And it was thin bland sauce - not spicy and didn't have chopped anything like  pico de gallo.  Also ambience is very dark.   If you walk in from outside, it'll take about 10 minutes for your eyes to adjust. 
Don't believe the hype.  Save some money and only go during happy hour.  Or better yet, don't go at all ( try tacolicious on chestnut instead!)
author: Katrina V.

description: What is that really ugly thing on the patio wall?   How can anyone eat anything after seeing that!
author: James H.

description: While walking in the presidio this afternoon I stopped by this restaurant looking for a late lunch, the outside is beautiful and it looked like this restaurant had much potential. From here I was disappointed. I walked into the restaurant to an empty dining room I figured they were just opening for their dinner service so I didn't think much of it. After a few minutes, I was greeted by one of the staff who told me to go to the bar and order there. I ordered a shrimp and carne Asada tacos and a coke, which came to a total of $19. I was excited for the food, but I was not prepared to have paid $20 for two bland  tacos barely the size of my palm.  I really want this restaurant to be great. But right now, the prices, bad food, and crappy service all will lead me to not return to this restaurant again.
author: Jack R.

description: It's just okay if you want a bite in the beautiful and historic Presidio.  I'm surprised though that the Trust awarded two restaurant leases to Tracy when there were so many better choices.  In general, among locals, the Trust has a reputation for ill advised and poor decision making.  This is one of many such examples.
author: Andy M.

description: The Presidio is a place to be cherished, not to be underwhelmed by tasteless snacks.  The initial looks are deceiving.  Perched along-side the Golden Gate Bridge, this atrocity barely gets by with ultimate compliment of mere existence.  Boring ambiance, boring service, boring food.  I only have one explanation of why such a view could be so blatantly avoided-The owner must be blind.  Or perhaps they were complete oblivious to their proximity to one of the seven wonders of the world.  Either way, it is inexcusable.  Additionally, the service was in subliminally sorry state of dissolution.  My best guess is that they were under the impression the food & beverages would serve themselves. This is without even mentioning the food itself: some poorly plated Costco microwaveables (not undermine Costco's excellence) of an excuse for Mexican cuisine.  The only shred of hope we have here is statistics.  Statistically speaking, a restaurant in San Francisco is unlike to stay open for more than a few months.  I can only hope the odds work in clear-minded individual's favor.
author: Max H.

description:
First sign of a good Mexican restaurant is the freshness and quality of what would seem to be the simplest thing -- tortilla chips. Yet, so many restaurants have stale, tasteless or out-of-a-bag looking chips. These were fresh out of the oil and complimented the guac and two salsas very well.  The guacamole was fresh, but could use a little more kick -- maybe some lemon and habaneros.  

Andrew behind the bar is a genius with the cocktails. I told I liked sweet drinks and my husband liked strong ones.  I don't remember what mine was called (something with 'fog' in the name) but it was fantastic -- with dried hibiscus candied in rock sugar, fresh fruit juice and other delicious flavors. My husband's drink had 4 ingredients -- and for each of these we received their well deserved description and history (e.g. Ancho Reyes and a Tequila from outside of the TDO) from Andrew.  

We had a chance to briefly say hello to the owner Traci, which was a treat.  

The food was uniformly excellent.  I loved the Albondigas soup - meatballs were hearty and it was nicely balanced by a simple but flavorful chicken stock.  We also had the jicama salad and the pork which were both delicious.  

We'll be back!

Sheela
author: S G.

description:
Okay, so I've seen some not-too-thrilling reviews of Arguello, and my response is "MEH."  It IS a very different sort of Mexican food establishment, but I kinda like it.  Granted, I went there on a weekday at the very end of what is considered the lunch hour, so it wasn't crowded, and we didn't have to wait to order. 
The first thing that impressed me was the tortilla chips.  They are actually made by frying tortillas!!  This is totally not common, at all, in any Mexican restaurant, or food store.  Whatever happened some years ago, possibly having something to do with health vs fat, every supplier of tortilla chips is using batter extrusion.  If you don't know what I mean, see if youtube has a video about it.
Anyway, the chips at Arguello are fabulous!! They came to our table warm and crisp, and I could barely stop eating them.  And believe me, I know about tortilla chips; I get my favorite ones at a Mexican grocery store in Los Angeles.
The grilled fish taco was excellent; the carnitas were very tasty, if a little lacking in fat, and I would order them again.  The mushroom quesadillla left something to be desired as I didn't detect any seasoning and didn't taste any cheese.
The restaurant itself is rather industrial looking, but it's comfortable.  The outdoor seating looked like a great place to eat, and is most likely wonderful on a non-windy evening.
Give it chance folks.
author: janice s.

description:
Good fresca
Beautiful setting
Beautiful patio

Mushroom quesadilla was pretty good
The guacamole was not bad ... small yet fresh


Raw review ...

 need more tasting ... this is a eat & run review

More to come
author: S.K. Y.

description:
We showed up for lunch, waited in reception then people started to show up and pass us. 5 minutes later I ask someone who was not clearly interested by customer how this works.

You need to grab a menu and get tot the bar.

We left as it was freezing cold and apparently they were not  excited about having customers that day.

Manager seemed awol.
author: Alex D.

description: GREAT guacamole and chips! Somewhat limited veggie options (I usually get a salad sans cheese) but it's a beautiful space to have lunch or happy hour. Friendly servers and bartenders as well. I really wish they didn't use disposable plastic (yech!) cups during the lunch service and hope that they'll switch to reusable soon.
author: M M.

description:
Would not recommend Arguello. SKIMPY portions but not priced as such. We ordered shrimp taco -2 small-ish shrimp  a few shredded bland cabbage and a shell for $5.50 per taco. Was not even flavorful. Same with carnitas taco and beef carne asada taco -.....tiny, flavorless AND COLD. We ordered the Albarino wine and it looked like a half glass for $11.  Mind you,  we ordered a glass of wine but it was so small it was like a wine tasting!   The person who took our order was completely unwelcoming and indifferent  after waiting in line at the counter to order. 
In the end, a total rip -off! If you have to order at the counter at lunch, they should price it accordingly....over-priced, flavorless, mediocre and ridiculously small portions.
author: Kathy M.

description:
Caution: avoid! 

The decor is lovely and the menu enticing. The food, not bad at all.

But poor management makes this a must miss.  Where do I begin?

We recently tried brunch here. The hostess took our name and said she's call us when our table was ready. We had to ask the wait time. We had to ask if we might wait at the bar and order a drink.

We did wait at the bar, but although we were given menus, no one ever took our drink order (lost revenue).

We were shown to a group table right in front of the open front door on a cold day. We asked if the door could be closed, since everyone in the place had their coats on, but, "Well, we'll have to ask the manager, and he's outside." After freezing for several minutes, we asked if we could move to a free deuce further away from the door (and why didn't they give us the free deuce to begin with, since it couldn't have been reserved for someone else, because they don't take reservations?). Again with the asking -- they would have to ask our waiter if that was OK (it was). The hostess granted us permission and added, "you can bring your things with you," motioning to our water glasses and silverware. The new table was cleared, but still dirty. Feeling privileged to have a table at all, we did not point this out.

Thus began our experience of being in limbo with the servers. The one who took our order (who seemed very competent) never returned or introduced us to our new waiter (if we even had one). The coffees we'd ordered before switching tables took a worrisome amount of time to appear. Our entrees came out shortly thereafter, so we had to ask for the chips and guacamole we'd ordered as an app. The entrees were unexpectedly topped with fresh avocado -- fine, but equally unexpected when later we were charged for the avocado add on. We had to ask for salt, pepper, and hot sauce (also an unexpected surcharge, we later discovered), which took quite some time to appear.

Of course, we did not expect any acknowledgement as we left, so were not disappointed when one was not offered.

We never did get the agua fresca we ordered (lost revenue). And the door never did get closed. It seemed the comfort of the staff took precedence over the comfort of the guests.

With all the great restaurants in the Bay Area, and with all the great service these restaurants offer, why would I even consider ever returning to Arguello? Sad.
author: Kate R.

description: Boring! The building, room, staff and tortillas were good. The food was incredibly bland. Nothing labeled spicy was spicy. The food was presented well and wasn't bad it was just. not. tasty. Mexican is supposed to be a fiesta in your mouth. This was a siesta :(
author: Sally S.

description: OK I tried to give them another chance. We are 0 for  2 in getting chips and guacamole delivered on time to the table.  How tough can this be? The food is good, not great, especially for the price. It's too bad because it is a beutiful space with tons of parking. The menu is way too limited. We had such high expectations of this place and they just aren't met. Sorry Tracy, no me gusto.
author: Mark C.

description: We had tacos for lunch (on Tuesday 3 for $10! Can't beat that!). They were good not great. We sat outside on a sunny day in the Presidio (that was priceless!). Staff was ok. No wait.
author: C L.

description: Maybe you need to be an officer to get some respect here.  No service except self service.  If you don't want customers between your late afternoon brunch and the evening service then you should close down.  Otherwise you leave people -- at least all of us sitting on the patio right now talking about how bad it is -- with a really, really negative experience.  And we were thinking it would be good to come back and have dinner.  But based on this afternoon's experience we will not only not come back but will strongly dissuade anyone we know to stay away.  Over priced, mediocre food and no service.  Clearly this is a big tourist trap. Not the place for locals.
author: Robert A.

description: I enjoyed the carne asada tacos. Everything seemed fresh and authentic. The mushroom quesadilla was also good. Great chips and guacamole.
author: Carla C.

description: The food and margaritas are delicious, but a bit overpriced. Zero stars for service. Been here four times and every time have had the worst service of anywhere I have even been. Particularly from the hostess -rude, dismissive and unorganized. This place has potential, but the staff seriously needs to get their act together.
author: Ashley L.

description: Like they open up at 11am. Food offering is limited with short menu but that doesn't detract the great quality ingredients and taste. Location and outside patio a plus.
author: Andrew B.

description: how does Tracy des Jardin get so many restaurants in the Presidio and they are all medicore and expensive just like her 2 restraunts at ATT Park..Does she have some inside connection to City Hall or the Presidio Trust.   Arguello serves crappy cheap Mexican food at gourmet prices to clueless patrons at Arguello.  Skimpy on supermarket chips, the portions are tiny and costly but mainly the flavors are more evocative of the forzen foods selection at Safeway than tasy homemade Mescian cuisine.  Skip this place and your money will be better spent elswhere....
author: Eugene P.

description: The snapper was phenomenal.  Grilled served on a bed of rice topped with poco de gallo!  Enough for 2, unless you're really hungry!
author: barry w.

description:
Went to check out the newly remodeled Officer's Club in the Presidio (beautiful interior renovation) and stopped into Arguello before heading out. 
Lovely space, points for an outdoor area. However, I spent nearly $40 total (including tip) on one delicious drink (El Presidio $12) and two disappointingly overvalued dishes, the mushroom quesadilla ($10.50) and the chicharrones( $7). The quesadilla was miniscule, more like an appetizer rather than a brunch level entree, as the price implied. Barely warm, under seasoned, overcooked mushrooms and barely there melted cheese between two 6", chewy, flavorless, almost undercooked tasting, corn(?) tortillas with a thin line of tomatillo salsa and cotija cheese. Size and quality did not justify price. 
The chicharonnes were tasty, like "pork popcorn," as the bartender pointed out, but again, not something that I'd rush back to experience over and over again or even recommend.
New concepts in upscale fast-casual dining combining beautiful spaces with simple "pseudo-authentic" ethnic food seem to be reaching for diners who think they're getting a great experience without having to dress up, never eat food with their hands and/or have huge credit limits. Unfortunately, they lose sight of the value that motivates discriminating diners on more restricted budgets to return again and again. Arguello was not a satisfying experience.
author: Heather K.

description:
The location is nice and parking is no problem, which is great.

We arrived at the front desk and were told there was a 30 min. wait for a table. We said great, our friend will be here in 30 min.! The hostess suggested we just eat dinner with our friend at a bar table. The bar table is tiny. She reluctantly took our name for a table in 30 minutes. 

We were seated on time and our waitperson was friendly and gave us time to settle in. Once we'd gotten our food, she didn't come back until we'd finished. If she had, my husband would have told her that there were only two shrimp in the three shrimp shells which covered the entire plate, and the shrimp were not not fresh. 

I had a carne asado taco which was ok. The fish taco didn't seem like fish and was also bland. I hoped the food would be like Copita in Sausalito. Not even close.

Disappointing experience. Bland and expensive food. We won't be back.
author: Leanne S.

description: Come on. This is not a 2.5 star place. This is a neighborhood gem that is a bit slow to launch, service-wise. That's ok. Because a lot of the food is fantastic. The chips are even better than what they used to serve up at Tortilla Heights, which were lightyears ahead of most the crap they serve at any Taqueria in the Mission, sans La Taqueria. Arguello's pork shoulder is to die for. Tender, moist, well flavored and basically you can't stop eating it. The chicken verde is a plus too. Dark meat, but still fantastic. I'd also suggest both squash dishes, the main and the salad. Don't miss the guacamole, it's a tad pricey, but who cares, it's perfectly seasoned and will be devoured in about 3 minutes. The tequila list is one of the best in the city and features 7 Leguas tequila (in blanco, repasado and anejo) which is the benchmark brand which all other distillers can be compared too. Hopefully the can have more salsa assortments and tad better decoration on the outdoor patio (and a few more heat lamps.)
author: Brian J.

description:
I went for brunch on a Sunday around 2pm. There was a long wait for a table, even though there were multiple empty tables. We were told that the KITCHEN was full. We were told that we could go wait at the bar; only problem was that the bar was full. I understand that they were busy...but why couldn't we sit down while we waited? Instead we had to stand in the corner and try to keep out of everyone's way.  While we were waiting, a couple walked in and was seated immediately. We heard one of the couple say to the other "I'm glad that we called ahead so we didn't have to wait". WHAT? It clearly says on the website that they don't take reservations. My guess is that they are regulars and favorite customers, but it's disheartening to have spent 20 minutes standing against a wall, trying to stay out of the way of the waiters, and then listen to someone be pleased that they didn't have to wait.

Food! 
We got chips, salsa and guacamole. The chips and guacamole were excellent! Very generous amount of guacamole. I've read other people complaining about being charged for chips, but I imagine the chips aren't free because they are deep frying actual tortillas rather than just dumping a bunch of chips out of a bag. 
We ordered huevos rancheros, fish tacos, and banana pancakes. The huevos were on top very dry corn tortillas, with rubbery cheese and a fried egg on top. Beans were on the side. My beans were whole pinto beans but my dining companion's beans were all mushed up and cold. The beans had no flavor, and as the salsas we ordered with the chips were also very, very mild, we had to ask for hot sauce and salt. The fish taco was okay. The fish itself was delicious; crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. Unfortunately, as with the huevos rancheros, it was served on a dried up corn tortilla with some flavorless wet cabbage. I ate the fish and left the rest. The banana pancakes consisted of three pancakes, a lot of banana and caramel syrup. Yum! 
When my friend ordered coffee at the end of the meal, she was told "Sorry, we're closed". WHAT?? She was able to get a cup of decaf that she said was awful (but we weren't charged for). 

Our waiter, Kristina M (name on our receipt) was very nice, checked back in frequently and did a good job. I'd like to eat at a restaurant with better food and Kristina as our waiter.

There were definitely some yummy things to eat..the chips/guacamole and the pancakes. Everything else was mediocre and bland. I don't understand why. Maybe because the restaurant is in the Presidio they figure that they are catering to a tourist crowd who may not be used to big flavors or spicy food? I have had more flavorful beans dumped straight out of a can. This is San Francisco. This is a Traci Des Jardins restaurant. Very disappointing.
author: Kate M.

description:
I would agree with many of the previous posts.

We went last Sunday and the adults in our party had the pork shoulder and chile verde.  Both were tasty (not as good as Nido or Dona Tomas) but the portions were on the small side and the prices did not reflect that.  And the menu selections were very limited.

What really soured our experience was the extremely poor and slow service.  We were there when they opened at 5pm; it took our server 20-25 minutes to come over and take our drink orders (at which time we were ready to order food too); it took another 35-40 minutes for our food to arrive.  By that time, we were starving and grumpy.
author: Denisea A.

description:
Andy Goldsworhty in a patio  NOBODY sees!  What is all that about!??????!

Sacrilege!!!

Guacamole and chips, excellent!!!Sangria, Declicious! 

Today, Thursday, 3/26, prices, service, and food, Excellent!!!  Coffee from Ecuador, Excellent.  

Wines - you need to steer away from their cheaper wines. They are Horrible.  The pricier wines are great!!!

Caramelized Pork, curtido and salsa, excellent. and delicious!  Chicken, great!  Tortillas, almost great.  The tortillas need to be more moist or flexible.  


Nevertheless, we will be back.  Lovely on a beautiful day!  

Monica and Eric are great!  Ronald needs to stay on top of things.
author: Emily G.

description: Agree with many of the service comments from others but Traci is here working hard so my guess is this will improve over time.  Manager is stepping up which I do appreciate.   Give this place a try.  Bottom line:  good quality food though SF might be used to more spiciness, great location and service that's still work in process
author: Terence F.

description:
4 stars for food, 2 stars for service (would be 1 star but for a manager who took the reigns when we finally lost our patience)

4 stars: Good location in the Presidio with tons of parking. As well, the food & drinks are pretty good (though not particularly generous portions)

1-2 stars: But the service is deplorable. No reservations, so we put our name in and had some drinks on their lovely patio. The first estimate was an hour. After an hour and 15 minutes, we were told it would be another 15 minutes. After an hour and a half, we were told "the tables aren't turning. I don't know what to tell you." After an hour and 45 minutes, the host pretty much wouldn't help us.  So, we finally tracked down a manager who found us a table and actually took our orders/served us/hooked us up with free dessert.

As well, the bar situation is a disaster. While the drinks you eventually get are good, they are expensive, and there too few people working and the bartenders are rude.

The concept is great, but they really need figure out the service situation soon (which they should. This isn't Traci des Jardins first restaurant!)
author: Sara S.

description: I had brunch there recently with friends. While the food was good the waiter gave me attitude when I asked the price of the mimosa. I had had one, and he asked if I wanted another and then I asked the price. He said, "8 dollars, I think," and something like, "who cares?" and it turned out to be $10, and I actually care about what I pay for things. I didn't order the second one and I'm really glad I didn't as that would have been about $26 for two tiny orange juices with a splash of champagne including tax and tip!
author: Rich M.

description: We love Traci des Jardins and Mijita, but this was incredibly disappointing. We ordered two of the squash plates, one mushroom quesadilla, a jicama salad, and a remarkably small order of cilantro rice. The squash was extremely bland. It was large amounts of unseasoned squash with small bits of unmelted mild cheese, served on an unsalted tortilla. The mushroom quesadilla was pretty good, but not amazing. There were a few too many of the slightly slimy mushrooms. If you really like mushrooms you would probably be happy with this. The jicama salad was okay, again a little bland and unoriginal. For three very normal- size average eaters, this wasn't enough. We went home and made some more food. The service was good. This whole meal was pretty unremarkable and tiny for $72. After paying that much for three people, we are still very hungry.
author: Marcia L.

description:
Traci, you can do better!  And you should before this place affects your good reputation.

The location and decor of Arguello is fantastic.  I love the officer's club with its family and little kid friendly spaces.  The restaurant is set in a beautiful location with a nice back patio and well-done rustic furnishings.  

However...the food needs improving.  While the guac and chips are solid, things go downhill from there.  The carnitas taco had bland, flavorless meat.  The eggs divorciado were bland missing salt, pepper and spices.  The chorizo and egg burrito was also really bland with no chorizo flavor and it was the same size as my 2.5 year old's bean burrito--tiny.  I don't mind rustic cuisine, but it shouldn't be boring, which is how I found my two meals here.  

This place has so much potential, but at this point, Padrecito and Nopalio blow it away.  I hope Arguello improves asap.
author: David P.

description:
I see others were disappointed. We were too. We went for dinner on Saturday night to celebrate a birthday. We were excited to be trying a new place. The setting at the Presidio is beautiful and the space is nice, but that is their only saving grace. It is a very, very loud place inside. Difficult to converse. 

The waiter took a long time before we even got our orders in. We only had one drink order, a pale ale. We ordered a guac and chip appetizer, salads to share, and main plates. We then settled into spending a lovely evening in celebration. We waited a long while before our water was refilled. My friend did not like the beer and found it left a very bitter aftertaste. 
We also waited a long time before we got anything to eat and much to our surprise, the hot plates came first. No apology for them coming, just the question "Was that ok?" Really? We just looked at each other and said "Why not!" Well, the salads were brought out next and then the guac and chips...all within about two minutes of each other. Our only choice was to eat the hot plates first. 

The waiter gave us one beer to make up for this and remember, the beer was too bitter to finish the first one. The waiter did admit the order of the food was his fault when he keyed it in. Good for him.

There are only four main dishes on the menu and we got the port shoulder, pollo and squash dish. Each of these dishes were very bland and as a vegetarian, I was extremely disappointed in the squash dish. Only two small pieces of squash in a bowl with all zucchini in a bland luke warm white liquid. I could not finish it. These were served with corn tortillas that fell apart when you unwrapped them. 

So, we ate in reverse order. 
  
We ordered desert and they had only one chocolate choice in the four deserts. A churro with chocolate. It is what the birthday girl ordered. The waiter took our order. Returned to the table after about five minutes and let us know they didn't have this on the dessert tray today and they forgot to tell the waitpeople in the line. 

He asked if we still wanted the Mexican cookies we ordered. We all just burst out laughing and said, forget dessert, give us our check, we just want to get out of here! 

This whole process was unenjoyable and over $100.00 later!!!

Oh, BTW, he did give us the Mexican cookies on the house. They were also not very good.

Really a huge disappointment, a house of cards experience and probably in my top three of disappointing restaurant experiences.
author: Pat O.

description: So disappointed!  Everything had no flavor. Salsa was blah.  Guacamole was blah.  breakfast burrito was a flour tortilla with eggs that had a little chorizo in them.  nothing else in the tortilla.  I was shocked by how basic and boring the food was.  gorgeous location and reasonable prices -- but you don't get anything for it.
author: Genevieve B.

description: Service here is awful! The food is expensive and PREMADE.... I guess there some super chef here but she should be very disappointed with her work and staff.... We live in the presidio and just thought this would be a good easy place... NOPE.. We had one really great server and one that is totally rude and acted like it's our fault for the food not all coming out at the same time.  Avoid this place... So many good restaurants in SF; go there instead.
author: Ryan G.

description: I don't write reviews much but I think this place is weirdly underrated on Yelp, so I'll chime in. I've gone here twice recently for brunch. Once just me and my SO, and the second time with a party of six. Both times the service was friendly, food was tasty, drinks were delicious, and the historic setting totally charming. I've ordered the chilaquiles and seasonal pancakes and enjoyed them both very much. First time we sat inside, second time on the patio because it was a beautiful warm day. The patio is dog-friendly and our server immediately brought a little glass of water for my brother's dog as soon as we were seated. The bar got backed up during our meal, and one of our drinks came out very late. We were in no rush and didn't complain but our server apologized anyway and comped us the drink. Nicely done, Arguello, keep it up! So glad to have you in the Presidio!
author: Nick P.

description: Had dinner there last night after a music event next door. We had a group of about 10 people. Overall the food was okay, even with stale chips, not fantastic. When our food arrived, the waiters had no idea who got what, so it was a big guessing game. No big deal, and the service overall was quite good and the restaurant accommodating.  We did not sit outdoors, but their patio area looked quite inviting, especially on a warmer night. A huge parking lot across the street with plenty of free and easy parking too.
author: Scott F.

description: Love this place. Bartender knows his shit and is one of the most knowledgeable bartender's I have met.
author: Tyler H.

description:
This was my second time here in the last 2.5 months. We arrived early the first time and the line wasn't too bad but we were a group of 5 and there was a lot of getting up and down ordering, then ordering more which made for a not very relaxed lunch with the girls. Food was good, portions small, a bit overpriced, ridiculous price for chips and guac. Margarita was excellent! 

Today I took my husband and we arrived at 12:30, our bad, waited in line for about 10 minutes and could see it was not moving and the restaurant was only 1/3 full. Why not have table service?? Give people jobs, earn tips for good service. The reviews are obvious that the stand in line thing is not working. There is only one woman taking orders and people stand there as a  group and ask questions and then try to figure out how to break up the bill as everyone else waits. We shared 4 tacos and one margarita and it was $30, and we were still hungry. Forgot to mention, we left the line and went for a 45 minute hike around the Presidio (lovely!) and then checked back at the restaurant and there was no line so we quickly ordered. 

Love the idea, the location but just have full table service. Just don't understand this wait in line concept. Not sure I'll go back.
author: Marina K.

description:
Best to avoid..  The whole "scene" was disorganized.  Service was bad and slow.  Guacamole - plain and boring.  Carne asada tacos - meat was chewy and tough; shrimp entree - shrimp hadn't been cleaned; tortillas - bad, stale; albondigas soup - reminded me of Spaghetti O's, the kind with meatballs, plus tomato broth.  all around unacceptable.
+ the cocktail El Presidio and the chips were good.
author: Vanessa A.

description: We had high expectations after enjoying lunch and dinner at the Commissary sister restaurant. But we were disappointed in both lunch and dinner at Arguello. Service is spotty and the servings are somewhat small, not that tasty and too pricey. The chips and the tortillas are stale and tough. The tacos were very small. The lengua appetizer was tough and flavorless, like a piece of leather. The frijoles rosas tasted like they came out of a can but with less flavor! Perhaps they are trying to do too much with the menu and have taken their eyes off of the basics. While we love the atmosphere and location, there are too many other good dining options in town to bother coming back here.
author: Michael B.

description:
Completely underwhelmed. Stand in line to get to cramped ordering area, where it's less than obvious you need to pick up your cutlery (the spoons are seriously oversized, the knives missing) and then wait rather a while for the harried staff to bring all the courses you ordered at the same time.

The staff are just dropping off food, not trying to upsell you anything or check your food is ok. And did I mention the food was remarkably bland and simple?

You can see the chef and swanky people in suits (investors?) standing a ways off and smiling in a self satisfied way, no wonder as the place is busy and overheads must be minimal. If only the location had more competition then they'd have to up their game and provide a quality experience.
author: William R.

description: This place was great! Unlike the earlier reviewer, there are no burritos here. The food was interesting and delicious. Great drinks. Wonderful atmosphere. Traci herself was there during the opening weekend of Presidio Officers Club. I highly recommend s visit.
author: Joe S.

description: If you are visiting the Presidio area, Arguello is a nice, casual destination for 'nouveau' Mexican food. The menu is limited but the execution is excellent. Pricing is very reasonable. A few entrees done well is better than an oversized menu which is executed mediocre.  The chips have the crunch and density that I prefer. The guacamole was a perfect complement. The drinks were substantial, fresh and flavorful.  The entrees delicious.  Not necessarily worth a special trip but a perfect complement to touring the Presidio area, museums and want to sit down for a really, good, casual and unpretentious meal. The location within the restored and historic Officer's Club make this an especially worthwhile reason when visiting the Presidio.
author: Dennis H.

description: Just got back from this silly place. The location is lovely, but I will never go here for mexican food again.  The lunch menu was about 8 items, and they were out of 4 of them. Portions were appetizer-sized. I'm guessing if you go there alone you get the fist- sized bowl of chips, but I brought 5 people, and still got the same bowl. There are so many great mexican places in SF. Don't waste your time and money here. Now I'm going to fix myself some lunch.
author: Wendy W.

description: Eclectic contemporary Mexican food created one of the city's top chefs. Nice sunny patio. If you haven't seen the Officer's Club yet, you'll find a gorgeous great room (cocktails by the fireplace here), small museum, and fun, casual bar/restaurant. Easy easy to get to in the Presidio and tons of parking.
author: Karen M.

description:
The first time we tried eating here we walked out.    Who wants to eat a meal sitting on a backless stool?    Warning:   this is the area by the bar.

We thought we'd try again today.    This time we got a table with 2 chairs.    Wow!!!

The food is expensive and the portions are small.

The service is amateur and totally unprofessional.    I very clearly ordered a glass of Chilean syrah blend for $9.00.   When we got the bill, I was charged  $12.00 for another red wine instead.   I pointed this out to the waiter but he made no effort to redo the bill.   The customer is wrong and the restaurant is right.    Arguello made a quick $3.00 profit on me.    I'm the fool.   I should have taken it out of the waiter's tip.
author: Calvin L.

description: Sunday brunch: wonderful location; amateure service, mediocre food. Hostess does not even say hello, she just grabs a manu and walks off apparently expecting you to follow. Tea is tasteless, it is basically lightly colored water; coffee is served with milk - they do not carry cream or half and half. Other house drinks like lemonade are full of sugar; and so are pancakes - unbearably sweet. Prawn salad was very small, it could do as an appetizer but not a meal.  Though located in a absolutly beautiful spot, the total ambiance is that of a food court.
author: Sandra N.

description:
Customer service at Arguello is deserving of a negative star rating.  We didn't have to wait long to sit, but then we were further rushed to order a meal in order to keep our table.
