When that didn't happen to their timely liking, we were told to stand and give up a table.  The approach by the manager was not one that was welcoming and definitely not appreciated.  Our server felt so bad that he tried to make it up to us.  

Overall, the food is average...the tequila cocktails are amazing.  But when you have service that makes you feel belittled, we pass and you should too.
author: Desiree L.

description: very mediocre food... we ordered chicken, shrimp & pork. The shrimp looks great but be prepared to peel it, chicken was fatty and lots of bones - same with the pork. Chips and Guacamole were the best thing we ate there. The drinks were ok- wine list was disappointing seeing as we are a stones throw from some of the best wineries. Service was very average at best. Atmosphere was nice, very loud. Will not go back.
author: C A.

description: I am seriously confused by all the bad reviews. I ate here last night and it was delicious (and I am, admittedly, a bit of a foodie).  The quantity of food and the price were both completely reasonable.  The wait staff was super friendly and helpful.  The atmosphere is delightful.  Maybe the low ratings happened when the restaurant was first opening?  Y'all should go back and try again.
author: Dorrit G.

description:
Food was very very below average and prices are WAY too high. Restaurants in SF are pricey but this was absurd, and I like expensive food. 

DO NOT GO HERE
author: L D.

description: Pricey drinks and okay food. Menu was limited. Killer salsa - that gets 5 stars. Friendly staff. Spent over $100 and left hungry without eating anything that felt substantial.
author: Kim W.

description: Really, really slow service. It took fifteen minuted to get chips and salsa. Food was okay, but nothing special. Cool space, and nice outdoor area.
author: Alex L.

description: I give this place 2 stars just because I like the location.The food is okay, it's whitewash Mexican food. I know it's new but the service there is really bad,our food came but we had asked for are drinks and they came about five minutes after we asked. I blame management for lack of training For their service staff.i don't think I will go back , unless I hear big changes with their wait staff. One thing with the food I found it very under seasoned.
author: Pat C.

description: The taquitos & quesadillas at the Aguello Resturant were almost as good as Taco Bell & cost 10 times more! The service was poor.  The Precidio grounds are wonderful with a unique view of the Golden Gate Bridge. Just don't go to the resturant.
author: Robert R.

description: Just like everything the Presidio has done, over priced & mediocre. Small portions of just ok food for hi- prices. Menu was extremely limited. The red salsa was disgusting at best.  Didn't care for the get in line & order style. Could have had a much better meal at Gordo's for a fraction of the price. The drinks were good!
author: Paul J.

description:
Delicious food, great atmosphere, and good service. Not sure what people are complaining about...if you want free chips and guacamole, go to a cheep taqueria...it is custom to pay for something like this. 

This is a wonderfully thought out experience brought to you by the talented Traci des Jardins. Well worth the wait.
author: Traci P.

description: Arguello is a difficult restaurant to use. I live nearby so maybe I will keep trying. They seem to keep changing their hours, so often when I've gone by, they are either closed or having a private party. When I had the tacos they were tasty but very small. One bartender was friendly but another one definitely was not. All in all, they seem ambivalent about actually wanting to be a restaurant. Maybe they will get it together in the future. Hope so, cause it's an awesome spot.
author: Aria J.

description:
We tried Arguello on Saturday night and ended up sitting at the bar.  From our seats we could see Tracy expediting.  The ambiance is very nice... relaxing but still with energy.

The bartenders were very nice and the service overall was good.  One bartender was very helpful but the one who was supposed to be taking care of us really didn't check in with us enough.  Since it is still fairly new, they are still working out service.

We tried the sangria which was fine and Mexican mule (?) which was very good.  The chips, salsa and guac were good but nothing special.  The pork shoulder had good flavor, but was kind of dry.  The chicken on the other hand was delish and very moist!

Overall, it was a good experience and we'd go back.  We liked Arguello much more than Commissary.
author: Garrett H.

description: Don't bother going until January at the earliest - the service is just too poor, and maybe by then you can check the reviews and see if it improves. We signed up for a table at 5 on Saturday, and after being immediately seated, after 30 minutes I finally complained to the desk that we would like water and service. 10 minutes later we finally got our order in.  So if you come hungry expect an hour for food, and better get your drinks at the bar - it's slow but much faster than at the table. Food is OK but there are many other places just as good.  Margaritas are good too.  Decor is nice, and it is nice to have something next to the museum.
author: Brayton F.

description:
What a huge disappointment. Bland is the overall taste here. Nothing stood out. I realize this is "Mexican food for white people," but come on--a little taste would be welcome!. 

Plus, this was really annoying: They CHARGE for salsa if you want some to spice up their bland food. That is simply outrageous.

This is yet more proof that having a signature restaurant (Jardiniere) doesn't mean that other ventures will work out. My advice? Close your eyes, step into any Mexican restaurant in the Mission, and have an authentic and considerably better meal.
author: Fred S.

description:
Disappointing on a number of levels, but nothing was an absolute deal breaker -
Friday 6:15pm. Good amount of people waiting, yet host stand guy said "Actually, things are opening up, check back with me in 5 minutes." Since we were a group of three, I thought maybe there was some odd table that wouldn't fit two or four that we'd get. Anyway that wasn't the case - we were seated half-hour later as I assumed would happen. No big deal, but odd. And we would have had drinks while we waited if we weren't thinking the wait would be short.
Once seated - 
Chips, guac, salsa were all flavorful, but not outstanding.
Entrees -
Pork - seemed to be the best thing to order for flavor and amount of food. Person who ordered it was the most happy.
Squash/veggie make-your-own-taco thing - arrived a good five minutes after the first entree. They should put the bowl on a plate OR use a bowl with a lip or edge. Instead the meal is served in a cereal size bowl with a brown wrapper of two tortillas placed right on the table. Nowhere to put your taco between bits. A little bowl and a wad of brown paper just looks like a pathetic entree. The person who had this said the dish was "pretty good" but not memorable - not enough spice or flavor for her.
Shrimp - came eight minutes after the squash (yep, we were timing it at that point). The waiter noticed I had no food and went to the kitchen. Obviously, the shrimp hadn't even hit the pan at that point (which was LONG after the pork had been served) because it was several minutes before I got it.
The shrimp dish was three whole shrimp - you take off the head, peel and in the case of one of my shrimp, even devein it. Kind of messy with the sauce. I was up for it, but it should be mentioned on the menu or by the waiter. Not filling at all. Good I had ordered beans and more chips.
Margarita - best part of the meal, but tiny. It would take three ($30 worth) to equal the pint glass you get at many other places. 
Water glasses - tiny and constantly empty. Just leave a bottle of water on our table please. 
I work less than 10 minutes away and wish it could be a new go-to place. Instead it seems like one of those places you go on vacation, convince yourselves it was worth the trip, then never return.
author: M D.

description:
The drink menu was very good. The food was ok. Liked the mushroom quesadilla and the pork shoulder. The fish tacos were kinda weak. 

The vibe was...really a dud. Half empty and half executed. I felt like I was in the museum cafeteria and not a Traci des Jardin restaurant.  I live 2 blocks away but I won't be back soon. Hoping they can fix this.
author: Gary R.

description: So very disappointed in Arguello. The Presidio deserves a first rate restaurant and this is a pretender. One thing you should be able to count on in this part of the country is authentic, quality Mexican food. This is not happening at Arguello. My summer tomato salad for $13 consisted of two tiny pieces of lettuce and s few cherry tomatoes- it was restaurant robbery. When I told the server I was extremely disappointed, she really didn't care. I will never return until this awful restaurant is replaced.
author: N S.

description: Best margaritas I've ever had, and amazing food. The location in the Presidio makes it seem quaint, but it's a huge space with lots of history.
author: Crys C.

description:
The menu is very limited, although it does change often. We wanted the shrimp, which was one of four items on the menu; they didn't have them. We had a chicken dish which was very good. Interesting...I see people preferred this to The Commissary. I don't agree. Maybe they need to throw a burger on the menu. Seems like that kind of environment.

The noise level was outrageous and for that reason we wouldn't go back. The wine pours are tiny, about 5 ounces.
author: Lynn T.

description: Went here for lunch on a weekday. I work in the Presidio. What a complete disappointment! Restaurant looks nice, but tiny portions for the price. Ordered the jicama salad. Was so small, bland, uncreative and not filling. Genuinely, the worst salad I ever had at a restaurant. My male colleagues ordered taco roll things. They cost $10 and could not possibly have filled them up. If you are looking for food in the Presidio, Cafe Rx is the same price but the quality and flavours are outstanding, especially compared to this experience. Would not recommend or return!
author: JeriAnn G.

description: This is such a great place!! We were just there for a private party and the staff was so attentive to us and the food was SO delicious!! I look forward to going back in the future!!! Thank you for a great experience!
author: Kasse P.

description:
The Presidio of San Francisco represents the best of the history of SF, CA,USA, going back to 1776... Prior to that were the various tribes of Ohlone Native Americans... Then, the people from Old Mexico populated Alta California...  Once Yerba Buena became San Francisco, during the Gold Rush of 1849, many new cuisines were merged... Arguello, a fairly new Presidio restaurant, represents the Spanish/ Mexican/ Alta California tradition with an exciting menu, and standard of service...  With house-made chips, and a spicy Guacamole, and green and red salsa, your dining experience is "...off to the races..." Next is "still water or sparkling???"   
Then, attentive drinks-order taking, and info on the night's menu...  We split an amazing Jimica/ Citrus/ Avocado salad; then an equally exquisite "Pollo" dish, and we were off to heaven...
Arguello was memorable, in many ways...  We will be back, many times, and will recommend this wonderful restaurant to associates, friends, neighbors, and family, for many years to come...
author: CDR JAY C. O.

description: I dined here with my Mom and sister after a free Friday night concert provided by the Officers Club.  The service was rude and very disappointing.  I was given a hard time about requesting a decent pour of wine after I received what looked to be a half glass. I was accused of drinking it and then questioning the size of the pour.  Very poor taste by the server.   The food was decent but the menu is very limited and we were charged for just about everything...chips and salsa (which were extremely salty) and extra tortillas.   It was a fun atmosphere but based on the service alone, will most likely not be returning.
author: Mia G.

description: My friends and I went here twice about a year apart.  The last time was March/2016.  The first time we went, we loved everything about it.  We sat outside, wrapped in their blankets, near a warm fire.  We loved the food!!!  When we returned in 2016, our experience was different.  We sat inside, which was fine, but loud.  A party of about 20 next to us and lots of noisy children.  Also, the rosy glow of my memory from first visit was startled by the menu.  It seemed almost every dish had pork in it, which seemed limiting.  We took a long time time ordering because none of us could really find something that sounded good to us.  The reality of the food was also disappointing.  The dishes as described by our great waiter (who raved about everything) didn't measure up to his description.  The service was wonderful both times we visited.  First visit was a five star and second visit was a two star so we gave it three stars.
author: Nancy R.

description: Disappointing.  We were so looking forward to a Mexican restaurant in the Presidio!  The area needs some really good, down home style of food, and we totally thought, how could it not be if it's Mexican.  But alas it is not.  Small portions of over-priced food.  You don't get your money's worth.  It's too bad because with the bar and patio (which is awesome), this place could have scored!  Just a Mexican, fancy style restaurant that serves small portions at over-inflated prices.
author: Josephina F.

description: Food's decent, but overpriced. Service was too slow given how empty it was. I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Eli H.

description: Just went there for lunch and I have to say I am so disappointed. First, with the service. The woman taking orders not only has no personality but was offended if you asked her a question. Second, the portions were small and cold. $5.50 for one little taco. I ordered a glass of wine and the pour reminded me of a tasting I had in Napa. Lastly, left hungry with a $40 tab. To bad it's a great location, hopefully new management will take over.
author: Lorena M.

description: Traci, if you're reading this, for what you're charging, how about some waiters instead of waiting on a long line and how about WAY bigger portions. My office is just up the block from you and we're all avoiding Arguello now. I give it six months if you don't make some pretty drastic changes quick.
author: Rob R.

description: Mixed experience.  Good - Ceviche was outstanding.  Service was good - ate at the bar. Margaritas also good but expensive.  Bad - Fish entree was INEDIBLE - dry, flavorless, and with a gross dark green cilantro sauce on it not mentioned in the menu description.  Only ate the veggies on the plate, not the fish, and was still charged full price for the dish, with no comment or substitute offered from the chef.   Recommend sticking with the appetizers only.  A bit of a rip off.
author: A G.

description: I was really disappointed - having lived on the Presidio and eaten there often over the years I was looking forward to trying out the new non Army restaurant - went for brunch on a Saturday - the tortilla of the taco I ordered was tiny - there was no way to pick up and eat like a taco - had there been two tiny tortillas I could have made two tacos but as it was I had to eat half the meat with a fork - the lime dressing in the salad was way too tart for me - definitely not going back to eat - maybe for a drink on a nice day
author: Mary D.

description: Had a great time at Arguello. Came in early on a Friday evening and had no problem getting a table. Staff was attentive and food was excellent. Had the pulled pork and duck dishes with a churro for desert. Bartender Gabrielle is AWESOME!!
author: Richard C.

description: A very disappointing dining experience!  We ordered chips and guacamole, salads and entrees.  The entrees appeared at our table first, then the appitizers and salad. We had no choice but to eat our entrees as they would get cold along with the chips and guacamole and then the salad.  The guacamole and chips were the best part of the meal.  The other things were ok, but not anything special.  We attempted to order dessert, but they were all out of one of the four deserts at 6pm, the only one with chocolate in it.  As we were the first seating, that says the kitchen didn't make that dessert. The service was extremely sloppy, with the server reaching over a person to clear plates. Traci is spending more time at her other restaurants and this one needs her serious attention.
author: Klaudia H.

description: Restaurant manager was brusk, impatient, rude and unwilling to assist and accommodate me as a disabled patron.  I was left standing at what APPEARED to be the seating podium and had to attempt to seek assistance for attempted seating.  The response I FINALLY received was dismissive and uninterested; likely the accommodation was in violation of the provisions of the ADA.  My guest and I left both feeling highly offended.
author: George D.

description:
This review is not for Service - the place is less than 2 weeks old so spotty service is to be expected. This review is for a) value for money b) quality / taste of food c) ambience

Value for Money: 1 star - I have never felt so ripped off in my life. The $10 wine pours are a joke - apart from our table I overheard one other table next to us ask our server the same question "are the bartenders using some sort of a measuring device to pour these wines". The server claimed they were std. 5 ounce pours but I have never witnessed such a blatant attempt to rip off customers with such stingy pours. The fish taco for $4.xx and the steak taco for $4.xx are a complete joke - having lived in SF for over 20 years and having eaten at a lot of places, both cheap and expensive, Arguello is one of the worst in recent memory when you look at price and compare it to what is served on the plate as far as quantity is concerned. The $18 pork shoulder and the $6 guacamole were other examples of a gross attempt by this establishment to screw the consumer monetarily when you take portion sizes into account. 

Quality / Taste of Food: 2 stars - The best thing served was the habanero salsa - it was creamy, spicy and delicious. Outside of that the overall taste of things was poor. Not only was the guacamole  terrible value for money,  the taste was below average at best - bland and unsatisfying - the fish taco and the steak taco were both "meh" - thank god for the pickled onions that come with the steak taco - at least they added a bit of depth of the meat. The tortillas for the tacos were not fresh and extremely hard when they arrived - when you struggle to take a bite of a taco due to the lack of freshness of the tortilla, that is a bad sign. The pork shoulder was the best tasting dish served - it was decently cooked and had the tortillas been edible and had the price / portion been fair,  I would recommend it.

Ambience: 4 stars - the outside patio with fire pit presents a great vibe. When you have decent weather it is pretty sweet having the opportunity to sit and soak it all in. We were definitely happy to have found a seat by the fire pit and chatted with our neighbors for  a bit. The outside dining seats are likely the best place to eat when the weather is decent - they had blankets for people who felt chilly and I did see some cushions on the long benches by the fire pit for patrons to use to get even more comfortable. The inside of the restaurant is nothing special - a bit warm and noisy and par for the course in my opinion. 

If I were to take Service into account, I would give Arguello 1 star overall but based on everything else except Service, it's a 2 star rating at best. I realize this place is extremely new and has a lot of tweaking to do but I'm hopeful folks are taking feedback to heart as I would love to see this place thrive and be successful.
author: Anon Y.

description: Not only was the food unimpressive, but the bartender was beyond odd and frankly, downright offensive. To be fair, we were there on a night when they had a band and swing dancing in the Officer's Club so Arguello was slammed. However, the bartender was surly and made, in my opinion, probably the worst Manhattan I've ever had. A woman sitting at the bar commented on how rude the bartender had been to her and her group so aversion to this guy seemed to be pervasive. Later in the evening, my friends decided they wanted to eat so we took a seat at the bar, which was our only option. I usually love sitting at the bar, so this was fine with me. Well, the surly bartender is now our server and he makes the switch from surly to downright creepy. I order the pork. His response was to point at my Manhattan and say "I can tell. You look like you like to get porked." Wtf? My hearing is pretty damn good so I'm sure this is what I heard. I laughed it off, primarily because I think I was so shocked. So that interaction, combined with the mediocre food will keep me from returning to this place. It's a great space and I hope that a decent restaurant is established in Arguello's place.
author: Jen S.

description: The setting is nice, and when we were there it was one of the few spots open at the main post. The portions are very small, and the prices are high.  Overall,  I would find a different option if possible.
author: Jeff N.

description: Went here on Wed night and it was about half full.  The space is beautiful (it was too cold to sit on the patio, but it looked really nice), food was good and service was fine.  The price point is reasonable for the ambiance.  I wish they had a bigger menu, but we had the taquitos, the mushroom quesadilla and the shrimp entree.  The quesadilla was my favorite.  The shrimp dish was good, but it had the shells on and it's too much work for not a lot of reward.
author: Rose T.

description: It's new, so growing pains are expected. The bar service and drinks were awesome though. I'm more writing this, my first Yelp review (I'm a longtime lurker), just because it's infuriating to read the ignorant, racist remarks about a great chef. I don't know Traci des Jardins but I respect her work. And it was easy enough for me to look on Wikipedia and see that she's not a "gringo" as one reviewer so eloquently put it, but is Mexican-French. Perhaps the Yelpers that assume they know what Latina and Mexican mean should do their research before spouting off presumptions. Oh, and just as an FYI, Mexican food is far more than cheap tacos. Perhaps you'll enjoy the experience more if you're not expecting the equivalent of Señor Frogs jalapeño poppers from a celebrated chef.
author: Joan A.

description: Very disappointed.  Tracy has no IDEA of what real Mexican is. I will challenge her to go to real Mexico and explore the flavors and authentic Mexican food. As Mexican American I have explore the entire country of Mexico getting to know the the real flavors of Mexican food from sea food to tacos to mole, you name it. I love the place and where the restaurant is located. Employees are careless about costumers and seems like they have no idea what are they doing. The Latino Bartender seems to feel a little too important instead of being more friendly and not a stuck up person.I work at the Film center and 100% times still prefer the old now closed Kitchen 39 restaurant and friendliness of the latinos that used to work there. I hope this restaurant get little better with time regrading service, food and prices as it seem too much $ for a taco that I can get get for cheaper a taqueria in the mission.
author: Leonardo G.

description: The restaurant is very noisy, making it difficult to hear. The menu is limited in it's choices. The margaritas were good. The service was very well-timed and attentive. The food is on the pricier side, and was hit and miss. Some of it was good, and some of it was not. Overall, we have experienced better.
author: A Z.

description: Great food, however a bit overpriced and the service was average.  We came for brunch and the $5+ tacos (especially the shrimp taco) are great but a bit pricey for what they are. The breakfast burrito was flavorful, but needed salt and something to balance the dryness. At $15, it also needs to be either half the price or twice the size, it's pretty small for the most expensive burrito in SF. If they can better balance their pricing and get the service right, it could easily be a top brunch destination.
author: Tom A.

description: Tried to eat here last night and the place was closed for a private party - this was not posted on the web site, which I checked before going. Not good.
author: Diane O.

description: Very disappointing food and service despite great location and comfortable restaurant decor.  The service was terrible - the host/hostess screwed up our name on the waiting list so we waited nearly 1.5 hours and patio service was awful.  When seated, I had to finally grab a waitress after 15 minutes with zero contact (granted after my complaints, service was very good).  As for the food, the menu was limited and what we ordered - pork, chicken main courses and two appetizers - was lacking in flavor - an Americanized bland version of Mexican food.  Go to Mamacita's for high end Mexican food.  Probably won't go back except for drinks/chips on patio (guac was great but salsa again lacked any flavor and could have come from a bottle).  We also have eaten at her other restaurant in Presidio - Commissary - and had similar experiences.  Disappointing.
author: jeff w.

description: Came here to offer some advice on service to the management, but it seems like they have been getting plenty of suggestions for awhile now. So this too may go ignored: Instead of boring your staff with prep instructions in the doorway to the patio- blocking what little light that trickles in and causing noise population to those nearby - how about you helpful manager sir help the poor patrons you passed five times while they waited 15 minutes to place a drink order in your empty bar?
author: Melissa H.

description: Very disappointing.   The environment is beautiful but that's all it's got going for it.   Bad disjointed service.  Mediocre minus food
author: nancy r.

description: Was told a table for 5 would take 1.5 hours (they don't take reservations). Host suggested we sit on the outside benches where the full menu was available. Sat for 45 minutes without any acknowledgment from the waiter. Eventually got up And left without so much as a drink order. I live around the corner so I was hoping this could be my new spot. Sadly disappointed and will avoid in the future.
author: Maxwell M.

description: I'd like to be able to offer a review but, after plans to dine on Saturday night, we arrived to be told the restaurant was closed for a private event. Had we been allowed to make a reservation (they don't take them) we would have known not to choose Arguello. The hostess could not have cared less - so we were left to find a restaurant that would take us at 7 pm on a Saturday evening without a reservation. We chose Garibaldi's on Presidio - were seated at a table almost immediately and had excellent service and great meal.
author: Susan M.

description: Took my wife and our two adult daughters here for my wife's birthday dinner. Saturday night. The wait was 15 minutes or so around 6:30 PM.Not bad at all. We took our time and ordered items over time vs. all at once. We tried a variety of menu items and loved all of them. The food is nicely prepared and the portions are of a size that you don't pig out. The service was excellent. They were busy, but we observed that and simply relaxed. The margaritas were very good as well. Our waiter was a student at USF and he was attentive and professional. We'll go back. Plenty of parking as well BTW.
author: Average Guy R.

description: We visited Arguello for the first time yesterday for brunch! And although they are still in the process of becoming a smooth running machine,It was an overall great experience. The restaurant was quite packed, however the manager was very attentive,helpful and the service staff, although very busy, were still gracious and polite. We tried a variety of cocktails, which the overall consensus was that they were masterfully crafted and thoughtfully created. The food was good, stand outs were the chilaquiles,guacamole and the banana pancakes. The fish taco, squash blossom and pork belly was also good but slightly under seasoned. Other than the restaurant being hard to spot, it was a happy experience! I look forward to coming back for dinner!
author: Elle J.

description: Very nice decor. Our server was very friendly but clearly pretty overwhelmed (maybe she was new). Took a while to get our drinks. Chips/salsa/gauc were amazing. I got the pork shoulder which was good, not amazing. I didn't anyone else's food but everyone had the same opinion. Good, not great. Probably can get better food for the price.
author: Alex D.

description: Went for brunch.  Great space inside and out.  Service hit and miss (had to ask for silverware, cream for coffee (twice), given no serving spoon or small plates for shared sides (and the plates mains are served on are tiny), and server tended to disappear).  Menu a little limited, but the grilled shrimp taco was very good (lots of interesting flavors); the carne asada taco something of a joke:  it is heaped full of pinto-like beans, with very little meat.  Guacamole was a disappointment, but the chips are great.  I might return if in the area, but probably just for drinks and snacks.
author: Keith J.

description: Unless they change their whole format, we would never go there again.  When you walk in the door even at lunchtime, the noise level is unbelievable!  Then you have to wait in line to order the food.  I thought the food was O.K., but the other 3 people with me didn't like their meals.  At the end, I wanted to get a cappuccino but gave up the idea because it would mean getting back in line!   At the very least, Arguello needs to have table service.
author: Patty M.

description: If you like authentic Mexican food that is delicious and healthy, try Arguello Restaurant in the Presidio Officer's Club. The view is spectacular, the food is local and delicious, the small museum with the history of the Presidio is very interesting and the drinks are good. DON'T stand in line to order, sit at the bar, order a drink and the bar guy will take your order, then you can move to a table. It's great.The food was delicious, beautiful, unique, and reasonable, the ambiance comfortable with both inside and outside seating and the drinks delicious with a knowledgable bartender. I'm going back.
author: J. R.

description: Arguello was reviewed in the Chronicle a few weeks ago. We ate there today and it was undoubtedly the worst meal we have had in a very long time. I have never written a review before on Yelp but this restaurant warrants a bad review. You stand in line to place your order with the cashier behind the bar. We ordered the fish tacos. We sat and waited...and waited and waited. After a half an hour my guest went to the cashier to find out where our food was. She reported that the kitchen printer (where the orders are routed to) was having a problem printing. They had to track down our order and gave the  usual  "sorry about that" apology.   Yet, we waited another 20 minutes for the tacos to arrive. This was the worst part. They had been deep fried and the grease just dripped out onto the plates like being poured from a bottle. Really awful food. We will never go back and strongly recommend that you give serious thought before doing so yourself.
author: Harvey G.

description: Went last night (Saturday) and walked in at 7:30 and got a table right away.  A good beginning which unfortunately went downhill from there.  Server was friendly but service was very slow.  We got guac and chips right away, which was the best part of the meal.  Drinks were VERY slow to come from the bar.  My friend ordered a grapefruit /tequila drink which he liked.  I ordered what was purportedly a tequila/cherry brandy cocktail.  It was very small, unbalanced and had no discernible tequila taste.  I had the mushroom quesadilla which wasn't awful, just bland and, again, very small portion for the price.  Friend had crab taquitos which he liked but said they didn't have much crab.  Only 4 entrees to choose from.  I ordered the pork ribs which were unfortunately sold out.  Being sold out of 1 of your four entrees at 8pm on a Saturday night is not OK.  My friend and I each had the duck with pumpkin seed mole.  It was tasty but, once again, an incredibly small portion for $18.  It was one duck leg with sauce, no vegies or rice or anything else.  It was more like a generously sized appetizer.  Would it have killed them to throw a few vegies on the plate?  I left $100 bucks poorer and still kind of hungry.  By the way, it was also ear splittingly loud.  I won't be in a hurry to return.
author: Mark R.

description: skip this restaurant--I wanted to love it and tried Arguello 4x. other than the guacamole, the food all tastes the same. the serving staff are all distracted, and have an attitude  There are much better choices in the  Presidio area--go to The Commissary across the street!
author: Lrg G.
